story:
Thanks everyone for your support!

Mike Norton and his Mom are putting other campaigns' fulfillment to shame!  Here they are at the Post Office already shipping out Wheelchair People Pins to lucky backers! Go Mike!

Hope you'll get yours next!

Here are NEW DETAILS ON 2nd PART OF FUNDING WORK

We've raised enough to get started! YEAH!  Next funds to come in will go towards a scanner for Mike Norton and to get Cameron Naramore's project launched.  

Cameron is a wheelchair-bound maker in Colorado using 3D Printing.  He's especially interested in creating a head motion-controlled robotic arm that would use 3D Printing to make the brackets and fixtures to mount a portable system onto a wheelchair.  This robotic arm would really help people like Cameron navigate the world, but it could also be used at a workbench by non-handicapped makers as a 3rd arm.

While there's some work being done elsewhere on thought-controlled systems, Cameron wants to make something that is a lot faster to operate and easier to learn and control.  He needs these tools to create the head motion controlled prototype of his dreams:

  • Emotiv EPOC Development Edition - $500
  • Robotic arm with 5 degrees of freedom and 10 inch median reach -  $600
  • Software development - $1000 to get started 

We're on our way to giving these awesome Makers the tools they need for these cool projects! Below are the details on the entire project.  Thanks again for your support!

The FabLab Hub Team

================================================================


Last fall, FabLab Hub co-chaired a big Digital Fabrication conference in Portland, Maine and one of the most gratifying moments was when Mike Norton wheeled into the registration area to attend the one-day event.

After the conference Mike's Mom, Suzan, sent us a note saying:

When I first read the article in the newspaper about the conference, I knew I had to bring my son. He is wheelchair bound and he is an incredible artist who uses Adobe CS programs and is currently a student in the Communications and New Media Program at Southern Maine Community College. With the use of one finger, he does all his work. We have been reading about 3D printing and we know it is cutting edge technology. So I knew that he had to attend.

I must tell you that we felt like we had just attended a World Fair. We felt like we witnessed something so magnificent, like the invention of telecommunications, electricity and the internet. We particularly were interested in hearing what the manufacturers had to say as well as hear about their applications.

My son was fascinated and afterwards we networked with people...I left with more questions. I am involved in the medical field not by choice, but because I have a son with Muscular Dystrophy who uses a lot of equipment. He uses ventilators and cough assist machines (alone those cost $17,000)  I asked myself what lies in the future of these magnificent machines and what applications will they serve? 

The opening of the conference in the auditorium with the Keynote speakers from the MIT FabLab and 3D Systems Corporation was fabulous. The power point history of what is going on with FabLabs and 3d technology , left us in awe.  It is a fascinating time to be alive. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

Regards, Suzan Norton

FabLab Hub has also worked with Cameron Naramore who writes for 3DPrinter.net.  Cameron is wheelchair-bound and has been trying to use 3D Printing to make robotic arms.  And then there is the inspiring story of Raul Krauthausen, shown below, who 3D Printed portable ramps for his wheelchair.  Raul is just one example of how Digital Fabrication represents the Democratization of Manufacturing, giving opportunity to everyone.


So, we just knew we had to help get 3D Printers, supplies, scanners, and other tools to these awesome makers!  That's where you come in!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we're going to do...

FabLab Hub will raise funds to buy as much as we can in printers, suppliers, 3D Scanners and other tools for these inspiring makers.  We have local FabLabs that can serve as facilitators and provide space where needed.

Our first goal is to get Mike Norton in Maine, who we mentioned above, a Desktop 3D Printer and some material.  We'd also supply training, and if we raise enough funds, perhaps a 3D Scanner.  How sophisticated a machine we can purchase will be dependent upon how much we raise.  We're thinking at a minimum it will cost us $3,000 to outfit Mike properly, train him, and give him enough material to be able to print for 6 months.

Then we'd like to use the balance of the funds to help Cameron Naramore with his robotic arm R&D project.  Other makers are also in the wings!

Any amount we raise can get these special makers started, but the higher the amount, the more people we can help!

Special Rewards

While all our rewards are great, we wanted to talk a little bit about these special rewards.

Mike Norton WheelChair People Buttons

   

   

   

Whether the Angel, Weed Smoker, Wedding Couple, Wounded Warrior, Warrior King, or other fun image, you're sure to find 2 Buttons right for your message!

$25 REWARD:  eBook
3D PRINTING FOR THE REST OF US

Ever felt like getting into 3D Printing is too complicated to understand?  We know how you feel.  Although we've worked in Digital Fabrication since 1986, we do a lot of workshops and have seen how intimidating some of the work, especially CAD, can be to anyone new to 3D Printing.  But no more! Anybody off the street can jump into 3D Printing with some simple projects, and then refine skills as you progress.

Here's the Table of Contents of the 150 page eBook:

·  What exactly is 3D Printing?

·  What’s hype and what’s real?

·  How do I get started?

·  How much should it cost to get started?

·  What’s the difference in consumer 3D Printers?

·  How do I get designs for my printer?

·  Do I have to learn CAD?  What are some simple CAD programs?

·  Isn’t the simplest route to scan an object?

·  What are some basic, practical applications?

·  How are other people like me using 3D Printing?

·  What’s in the future of 3D Printing?


All our rewards are great and we hope you enjoy them!
THANKS for taking the time to read our story!

Software development - $1000 to get started 

We're on our way to giving these awesome Makers the tools they need for these cool projects! Below are the details on the entire project.  Thanks again for your support!The FabLab Hub Team================================================================Last fall, FabLab Hub co-chaired a big Digital Fabrication conference in Portland, Maine and one of the most gratifying moments was when Mike Norton wheeled into the registration area to attend the one-day event.After the conference Mike's Mom, Suzan, sent us a note saying:


When I first read the article in the newspaper about the conference, I knew I had to bring my son. He is wheelchair bound and he is an incredible artist who uses Adobe CS programs and is currently a student in the Communications and New Media Program at Southern Maine Community College. With the use of one finger, he does all his work. We have been reading about 3D printing and we know it is cutting edge technology. So I knew that he had to attend.





I must tell you that we felt like we had just attended a World Fair. We felt like we witnessed something so magnificent, like the invention of telecommunications, electricity and the internet. We particularly were interested in hearing what the manufacturers had to say as well as hear about their applications.



My son was fascinated and afterwards we networked with people...I left with more questions. I am involved in the medical field not by choice, but because I have a son with Muscular Dystrophy who uses a lot of equipment. He uses ventilators and cough assist machines (alone those cost $17,000)  I asked myself what lies in the future of these magnificent machines and what applications will they serve? 



The opening of the conference in the auditorium with the Keynote speakers from the MIT FabLab and 3D Systems Corporation was fabulous. The power point history of what is going on with FabLabs and 3d technology , left us in awe.  It is a fascinating time to be alive. Thank you for a wonderful experience.

Regards, Suzan Norton






FabLab Hub has also worked with Cameron Naramore who writes for 3DPrinter.net.  Cameron is wheelchair-bound and has been trying to use 3D Printing to make robotic arms.  And then there is the inspiring story of Raul Krauthausen, shown below, who 3D Printed portable ramps for his wheelchair.  Raul is just one example of how Digital Fabrication represents the Democratization of Manufacturing, giving opportunity to everyone.So, we just knew we had to help get 3D Printers, supplies, scanners, and other tools to these awesome makers!  That's where you come in!What We Need & What You GetHere's what we're going to do...FabLab Hub will raise funds to buy as much as we can in printers, suppliers, 3D Scanners and other tools for these inspiring makers.  We have local FabLabs that can serve as facilitators and provide space where needed.Our first goal is to get Mike Norton in Maine, who we mentioned above, a Desktop 3D Printer and some material.  We'd also supply training, and if we raise enough funds, perhaps a 3D Scanner.  How sophisticated a machine we can purchase will be dependent upon how much we raise.  We're thinking at a minimum it will cost us $3,000 to outfit Mike properly, train him, and give him enough material to be able to print for 6 months.Then we'd like to use the balance of the funds to help Cameron Naramore with his robotic arm R&D project.  Other makers are also in the wings!Any amount we raise can get these special makers started, but the higher the amount, the more people we can help!Special RewardsWhile all our rewards are great, we wanted to talk a little bit about these special rewards.Mike Norton WheelChair People Buttons         Whether the Angel, Weed Smoker, Wedding Couple, Wounded Warrior, Warrior King, or other fun image, you're sure to find 2 Buttons right for your message!$25 REWARD:  eBook3D PRINTING FOR THE REST OF USEver felt like getting into 3D Printing is too complicated to understand?  We know how you feel.  Although we've worked in Digital Fabrication since 1986, we do a lot of workshops and have seen how intimidating some of the work, especially CAD, can be to anyone new to 3D Printing.  But no more! Anybody off the street can jump into 3D Printing with some simple projects, and then refine skills as you progress.Here's the Table of Contents of the 150 page eBook:

· 
What exactly is 3D Printing?
· 
What’s hype and what’s real?
· 
How do I get started?
· 
How much should it cost to
get started?
· 
What’s the difference in
consumer 3D Printers?
· 
How do I get designs for my
printer?
· 
Do I have to learn CAD?  What are some simple CAD programs?
· 
Isn’t the simplest route to
scan an object?
· 
What are some basic,
practical applications?
· 
How are other people like me
using 3D Printing?
· 
What’s in the future of 3D Printing?
All our rewards are great and we hope you enjoy them!THANKS for taking the time to read our story!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Sara Rose and I’m the Founder and Creator of Britelites, an all new, patent-pending temporary hair color product that creates vivid results whether you have dark brown, blonde, curly or even coarse hair.

Watch the short video below that explains how the idea of Britelites came into fruition.  Also, be sure to check out our recent article in the Huffington Post on how we got started! :) 


Britelites was born out of that post-partum craze that some women get. When my daughter was about 3 months old, I was just dying to do something with my looks. 

I worked an office job and couldn’t get too crazy, so my stylist suggested hair chalk. I tried it and it just didn’t give me the look I was going for. It flaked out and got all over my clothes.

I had to wet my hair to get it to even show up...I knew there had to be a better way. (Wet hair chalk = yuck!)

I come from a very creative, right-brain background - at heart, I’m a musician and an artist...math and chemistry were never quite my thing. Having zero knowledge of chemistry, I completely utilized the power of Google during the initial creation of my product. During those hours where the baby “experts” suggest parents get a few hours of sleep, I was busy mixing up pigments, waxes, oils, emulsifiers, in my kitchen. 

After 2 1/2 years, I’m so excited to share this product you and with the world.


Britelites looks incredible on both light hair...


and on very dark hair...

Vivid color for dark hair is not something you will find in other temporary hair color products. Any temporary hair color product requires you to lighten / bleach your hair to achieve maximum results. 

Britelites is simply applied to dry hair and voila - instant gorgeous color!


Aside from looking incredible, Britelites is also very personal for our customers as the product itself stands for freedom of expression. Britelites is something anyone regardless of age, ethnic background, political standpoint, gender, creed or lack thereof can totally enjoy.

Our customers come in the range of toddlers...

teens,


college sports fanatics,


trendsetters and total rockstars like Kara Nally, 


super cool moms, 


and rockstar seniors! 


Here is what we need 

We are looking to raise approximately $20,000 to help us with startup expenses. Our company is expanding, sales are currently being generated and our customers love our product. Check out this fabulous review by Suma, the Fashion Beauty Junkie! 

As we expand, we have a greater need for improved manufacturing. Currently, my husband and I manufacture Britelites in house. We need to improve the speed at which we are able to produce the product, improve efficiency and reduce our overall product costs.

In order to reduce product costs, we have to purchase our materials in bulk quantities. This will drastically help us improve our margins so that we can get into a truly profitable status. 

The types of materials we would like to purchase in larger quantities include:

  • Plastic tubes that hold Britelites contents
  • Britelites ingredients
  • Shipping and postage supplies
  • Other packaging requirements

Additionally, we need to improve our equipment. Currently, we use a small double burner to melt the product ingredients. Every unit is poured by hand. 

We need to be able to invest in better equipment that will helps us manufacture at minimum 1000 units per day. This will require

  • Custom filling trays
  • Wax melter 
  • Filling machine
  • Labeling equipment
  • Shrink wrapping equipment
  • Improved printing equipment
  • Improved fulfillment 

We will then be able to keep a greater number of product in stock at all time, ready for wholesale and retail orders. Currently, we are bootstrapping it - orders come in and oftentimes we have to make and manufacture product on the spot. While this has helped us to increase our sales and get the Britelites name out there, it isn't necessarily all that profitable. Profits get eaten up by expedited shipping costs and higher material costs do to low order quantities. We are looking to improve our margins so that we can use those profits to build a truly successful business. 


The Impact

By helping to fund our company, you will be making a huge contribution to a small business dedicated to keeping manufacturing and jobs within the United States. We look forward to bringing on our first employees and creating a company culture that employees rave about! 

Here is why our project is valuable to you, as a contributor, and to the world. 

  • A product and brand developed grass-roots style, from my very own kitchen and front porch - to the masses!
  • Total commitment to US manufacturing and creating incredible job opportunities
  • A patent-pending product that is unlike other temporary products, creates vivid results in 5 minutes or less, easy to apply - goal of being the #1 temporary hair color company internationally!
  • A product that encourages and represents freedom of expression, equality and living life out loud


Other Ways You Can Help

Some folks just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Help us get the word out about our campaign! Share this link with as many people as you can think of who would be willing to support our campaign. We truly, truly appreciate it!
  • Please be sure to use all of the great Indiegogo share tools!

A product that encourages and represents freedom of expression, equality and living life out loud
Other Ways You Can HelpSome folks just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Help us get the word out about our campaign! Share this link with as many people as you can think of who would be willing to support our campaign. We truly, truly appreciate it!
Please be sure to use all of the great Indiegogo share tools!

story:
**an update** 

We added a store credit perk so that you can use it towards purchasing future dress designs when we have more options and size choices.

THE DREAM: Three summers ago, I sat on the beach skimming through an old magazine. I flipped to a page where I discovered the story of Eileen Fisher's company and learned that she started her clothing line with a mere $350 and a driven heart. It was in that very moment that I felt stirring in my heart to chase after my dreams of designing a line of dresses for girls. I have spent the last three years studying different dress designs, trends, color combinations, and styles.

WHY DRESSES?: For as long as I can remember, I spent many days of my childhood running barefoot through the grass wearing dresses and hair bows. There was always something so comforting about the breeze blowing and the joy and giggles I had. I recall spending many long hours twirling as I watched my dress spin and dance in the wind. 

MY MISSION: I currently make and sell hair accessories for girls + wedding parties in my studio in North Carolina, but would love to follow my dreams and expand the line to dresses. I carefully selected a company that would be able to create my designs with care and love. Each dress is handmade using beautiful fabric and of the utmost high quality. I wanted to ensure that these dresses would last for many hours of outdoor play, laughter, and twirling.

 

THE DRESSES:

I have designed four different dresses each available in different sizes. The dresses are ONLY available in the sizes that are listed. IF for some reason, this ends up exceeding the necessary funds, there is a possibility each dress will be available in more sizes.

 

 
 
The Katy comes with a polka dot/baby pink gem clip or a pink polka dot basic bow. If needed, it will come on a croquet headband.
 
 

The Stacey comes with a polka dot/baby pink gem clip or a basic white bow. If needed, it will come with a croquet headband.

 
 
 
The Kate comes with either a green/pink gem clip or green polka dot basic bow.
 

 

 
The Cheryl comes with either a baby pink/white gem clip or a white basic bow. 
 
YOUR CONTRIBUTION: The money that you donate to this project will go directly toward funding the first line of dresses. Each of the four dresses is a sample I received that I carefully studied and examined to ensure that its high quality and durable . Since I started as a handmade accessory designer, I am committed to ensuring that each dress is 100% handmade with love and care.

I CAN ONLY DO IT WITH YOUR HELP! Your donations will cover the costs of getting the the first batch of dresses produced, where I’ll send them to you!

While the line will only start with the four dresses shown above; there are a few more dresses designs in the works. So the more money=the more dress designs.

This is where you come in! I would love for your daughters or the special little girls in your life to be the first to wear my products and be a part of my story. But more than that, I would love for you to be a part of my journey towards making this dream a reality. Anything you can help to get the word out there would mean the world to me!

::::

HERE’S HOW YOU CAN HELP SPREAD THE WORD:

1. Tweet about it! I’m on twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/carolinegbows. Here are some sample tweets that you can copy and paste to make it extra quick and easy for you: (or feel free to write your own!!)

·      Look @carolinegbows is launching a dress line! Help her make these beauties a reality on @indiegogo: http://www.indiegogo.com/carolineg 

·      Cute dresses! @carolinegbows needs your help to make these dresses a reality on @indiegogo: http://www.indiegogo.com/carolineg

2.   Post about it on Facebook. Feel free to use the same messages as twitter or change them as you see fit. Please also like me on facebook! Feel free to tag me there as well.

3. Write about it on your blog. Feel free to use images and words from this site to share the dress line with your readers!


Thank you SO much!

please note: anyone who contributes $10 or more on May 7th or May 8th (the 1st and 2nd day of the launch) will receive an additional bow of their choice.

You will receive an email after purchasing a bow or dress where you can indicate what style of dress and bow you desire. None of the dresses in each styles will sell out of sizes.

story:
The Project

For a designer, the idea of Paris Fashion Week is akin to being a child on Christmas morning.  There is an electricity that permeates the air; vibrant with a beautiful array of possibilities.  Do you remember how it felt to wait all night just hoping the present you wanted would come?  Was it laying right there under the tree, wrapped up in gorgeous ribbons and bows?  But you couldn't touch it until mom and dad woke up?  Showing a collection in Paris is an opportunity that all designers aspire too.  Many designers have dreamed of this since childhood but very few get the opportunity.

The life of a designer is not just fabric, models and champagne.  It is long nights with the studio lights on at 3 am, and the fear of the 6 am alarm clock ringing in a reality all too familiar to the aspiring artist.  Many spend any and all spare moments that they can steal from the gray landscape of corporate America, in order to build their technique and refine their skills, but still most can not professionally break ground.  They create more hours in the day by forfeiting sleep just for passion.  However, passion does not always result in opportunity.  Artists and designers need someone to take notice.  They need someone to care.  They need help to attain their dreams.

Our Project includes five extremely talented designers that have an opportunity of a lifetime.  Each designer has taken their own path to this current crossroad.  Each have their own unique style.  They are ready for the next step in their careers.  The opportunity is available, wrapped in ribbon, but it's up to you to help make Paris Fashion Week a true reality...their Christmas morning.
Your contribution will assist with:

·  $9,000 entry fee

·  Flights

·  Accommodations

·  Insurance

·  Models

·  Makeup

·  Hair Stylists

·  Advertising

·  Promotion

·  Photography


Meet Your Designers  

Zachary Howell with Zachary/Nathaniel   

Zachary Howell was born and raised in Raleigh, NC. With Southern roots he grew up in the pageant environment. His sister was a huge influence on his design career. After he saw his sister’s wedding dress go from sketch to reality, he knew then that being a designer was his dream. Zachary pursued his dreams by going to Savannah College of Art and Design. After graduating in November of 2013, he has shown as FW ’14 collection at Charleston Fashion Week as an emerging designer. Now a day he is doing personal clientele work as well as designing his FW’15 collection as well as building his business in Savannah, GA where he calls home. 

Zachary Howell's attributed design philosophy can easily be described as a Dark Paradise. Taking influence and inspiration from various psychoses of the mind, and dysfunctions that twist the norms into their exaggerated forms. Twisting seamed lines around the body, his specific brand of evening wear finds itself emerging from the locked away secrets, kept hidden from the rest of world. A woman twisted from her Bacchic excesses is his muse, she exists within her own world centered within the comforts of the world known to the majority. 

For this collection Zachary, introspectively, referenced his interests in tragedies, and traumatic instances in history that have shaped many psychological archetypes in the human mind. www.zacharynathaniel.com

Brendan M Combs with BRENDANMCOMBS

Brendan Combs is the owner and head designer of his eponymous label, BRENDANMCOMBS, currently based in Savannah, Georgia. Prior to starting his line, Brendan attended The Savannah College of Art and Design where National Design Award winner Behnaz Sarafpour mentored him on his senior thesis.

He has produced two collections, begun a private custom client business, and was featured in the June/July issue of South Magazine.

BRENDANMCOMBS is defined as a fusion of sleek, and refined tailoring with a modern edge, and a nod towards the future. Drawing inspiration from youth cultures, music, and film. www.brendanmcombs.com 

Noelle Stanley with Holton House USA

Holton House USA is a couture and ready-to-wear fashion design house that specializes in upscale Women's apparel. Based in scenic Charleston Sc, this brand seeks to bring high fashion to the closets of it's customers by offering not only couture designs but a line of affordable ready-to-wear pieces that invoke a timeless sense of style. Established in 2014 by designer and founder Noelle Stanley, the Spring/Summer 2016 Couture Line will be the first professional collection launched under the Holton House USA label. Holton House USA seeks to celebrate the history of style throughout the centuries; reinterpreting art and literature into sleek textile forms that are meant to compliment the female form. Redefining modern vintage is their key philosophy but passion, dedication and perseverance are the brick and mortar of this brand.

Ms. Stanley is a self-taught designer who first gained attention with her unique children's wear brand, Ambrosia Star Designs. As a top 20 Emerging Designer for Charleston Fashion Week 2014, she represented the only children's wear chosen to compete and received the People's Choice Award warranting glowing reviews from industry insiders. Ms. Stanley has expanded her horizons into women's wear and is determined to bring an artist view of form and function to the forefront of fashion-worldwide with this the inaugural collection of Holton House USA.

 www.facebook.com/HoltonHouse

Brandi Bowen with Ever So Lovely

Ever So Lovely is a design studio based out of Raleigh, North Carolina where artist and designer Brandi Bowen creates one of a kind jewelry inspired by both nature and found objects. Earning her BA in Graphic Design from Meredith College, Brandi loved all things tangible and design and sought time away from her job on the computer. Combining her love of vintage beads, hand cut and hammered metal, along with sparkly gemstones - she creates unique earrings inspired by a summer's starlight sky. Her Heavy Metal line of necklaces are sure to add a dose of sweetness or sarcasm to your day. And her most recent collection, Mersea and Moon, draws heavily on her love of nature and all things "Wild and Free" where she creates one of a kind necklaces and earrings highlighting birds in flight, diving sea turtles and jumping foxes. To see more of her work visit her website www.ShopEverSoLovely.com

Sarah Markusich with Autumn & Parr

Autumn & Parr is a custom and ready-to-wear jewelry company that specializes in stunning silver work. Under the leadership of founder and jewelry designer Sarah Markusich, Autumn & Parr has evolved into a wealth-spring of creative energy, producing multiple lines of jewelry that appeal to a wide range of consumers.

Inspired by art, literature, and the culture of multiple eras from various regions of the world, Sarah blends each inspiration with handcrafted techniques to compliment her line. From soft autumn hues that hold an earthy appeal, to the newly minted Bridal collection of interwoven silver and pearls, this company seeks to bring out the beauty of each element and the woman who is wearing it. Mrs. Markusich has infused her own creative past as a nature lover, belly dancer, art history major, and mother of two into each design in the Autumn & Parr collection. In fact, Parr is Sarah's maiden name, to which she stated, “To move forward, you build on your past and everything you've come to love.” www.autumnparr.com
Paris Team

Models
Alexis Alexander, ShinHae Yoon, Tanis Beatty, Camie Ragsdale, Lexi Fonoimoana, Austin Olive, Samantha Peel, Mary Allen, Shivali Patel, Stefan Tesliuc, Elliot Kircher, Briana Graves, and Megan Olson
Staff/Writers/FOH/BOH/Photographers

Kourtney Hardin, Madison Moose-Barrington, Paige Tiller, Dawn Conner, Ozzy Ojito, and Leigh Moose
Hair & MUA

Kegan Dean-Rushing, Keiya Hinson, and Sergio Apaez Velasco

The Perks

Thank you Post Card ($15):

Thank you so much for being a part of our team! You will receive a hand written thank you post card with an image from The Project, from our designers.

Sponsor List ($30):

As part of our team, we would like to say thank you by adding you to our Sponsor List on all the designers and agents websites.

*If you are a business, we are happy to promote your link.

The Project Coffee Mug ($60):

The Project coffee mug featuring The Project image, from our designers.  12 ounce, 3 1/2" * 3 1/2"

The Project Tote Bag ($75):

Screen-printed 5 oz. 1"w * 14"h * 14.5"l cotton canvas tote bag featuring The Project image, from our designers.

   


Limited Edition T-shirt ($100):

A Limited Edition t-shirt featuring The Project image you will be proud to show off to your friends and family.

    


Holton House USA Scarf ($150):

One of a kind, handmade Infinity scarf by Holton House USA. These beautifully knitted scarves are 8" wide, 26" folded in half/52" total. They are made from acrylic thread, all USA sourced...extremely soft!  

Rings by Autumn & Parr ($250):
Handcrafted, sterling silver patterned bands that are perfect as knuckle rings, for stacking, or can be worn beautifully on their own from designer Sarah Markusich.  

One of a Kind ($500):
Have your very own one-of-a-kind piece made by talented designer Brandi Bowen with Ever So Lovely.  

Limited Edition/Numbered Design Sketch ($1,000):

One (1) print of a design sketch from designer Brenden M Comb’s Collection.  Limited edition run and numbered.  Print size measures 11x14 inches.  Museum-quality, acid-free white paper.

Signed Framed Limited Edition/Numbered Design Sketch ($2,500):

One (1) framed print of a Zachary/Nathaniel design sketch.   Limited edition run & numbered. Frame 11x14 inches & 2 inch mat.  Museum-quality, acid-free white paper.

Time Share ($5,000):

Your choice of state side or abroad booking Time Share donated by travel agent Brandy Pope-Woods.

Custom Design ($10,000):

Work with your choice of designer, Zachary Howell , Brenden M Combs or Noelle Stanley, on your custom gown made design.

** Collaboration with designer for your custom piece.  Fabric and detail items are at the discretion of the designer.

Social Media blasts from our team promoting you and/or your company, our sponsor, while we are in Paris.  Our team has 59,052 Facebook, 26,369 Instagram & 5,185 Twitter followers, along with 7 blogs with over 1,000 views per week.
story_txt:
The ProjectFor a designer, the idea of Paris Fashion Week is akin to being a child on Christmas morning.  There is an electricity that permeates the air; vibrant with a beautiful array of possibilities.  Do you remember how it felt to wait all night just hoping the present you wanted would come?  Was it laying right there under the tree, wrapped up in gorgeous ribbons and bows?  But you couldn't touch it until mom and dad woke up?  Showing a collection in Paris is an opportunity that all designers aspire too.  Many designers have dreamed of this since childhood but very few get the opportunity.The life of a designer is not just fabric, models and champagne.  It is long nights with the studio lights on at 3 am, and the fear of the 6 am alarm clock ringing in a reality all too familiar to the aspiring artist.  Many spend any and all spare moments that they can steal from the gray landscape of corporate America, in order to build their technique and refine their skills, but still most can not professionally break ground.  They create more hours in the day by forfeiting sleep just for passion.  However, passion does not always result in opportunity.  Artists and designers need someone to take notice.  They need someone to care.  They need help to attain their dreams.
Our Project includes five extremely talented designers that have an opportunity of a lifetime.  Each designer has taken their own path to this current crossroad.  Each have their own unique style.  They are ready for the next step in their careers.  The opportunity is available, wrapped in ribbon, but it's up to you to help make Paris Fashion Week a true reality...their Christmas morning.Your contribution will assist with:
·  $9,000 entry fee
· 
Flights
· 
Accommodations
· 
Insurance
· 
Models
· 
Makeup
· 
Hair Stylists
· 
Advertising
· 
Promotion
· 
Photography

Meet Your Designers  

Zachary Howell with Zachary/Nathaniel    
Zachary Howell was born and raised in Raleigh,
NC. With Southern roots he grew up in the pageant environment. His sister was a
huge influence on his design career. After he saw his sister’s wedding dress go
from sketch to reality, he knew then that being a designer was his dream.
Zachary pursued his dreams by going to Savannah College of Art and Design.
After graduating in November of 2013, he has shown as FW ’14 collection at
Charleston Fashion Week as an emerging designer. Now a day he is doing personal
clientele work as well as designing his FW’15 collection as well as building his
business in Savannah, GA where he calls home. 
Zachary
Howell's attributed design philosophy can easily be described as a Dark
Paradise. Taking influence and inspiration from various psychoses of the mind,
and dysfunctions that twist the norms into their exaggerated forms. Twisting
seamed lines around the body, his specific brand of evening wear finds itself
emerging from the locked away secrets, kept hidden from the rest of world. A
woman twisted from her Bacchic excesses is his muse, she exists within her own
world centered within the comforts of the world known to the majority. 
For
this collection Zachary, introspectively, referenced his interests in
tragedies, and traumatic instances in history that have shaped many
psychological archetypes in the human mind. www.zacharynathaniel.com
Brendan M Combs with BRENDANMCOMBS

Brendan Combs is the owner and head designer of his eponymous
label, BRENDANMCOMBS, currently based in Savannah, Georgia. Prior to starting
his line, Brendan attended The Savannah College of Art and Design where
National Design Award winner Behnaz Sarafpour mentored him on his senior
thesis. 
He has produced two collections, begun a private custom client
business, and was featured in the June/July issue of South Magazine. 
BRENDANMCOMBS is defined as a fusion of sleek, and refined
tailoring with a modern edge, and a nod towards the future. Drawing inspiration
from youth cultures, music, and film. www.brendanmcombs.com 
Noelle Stanley with Holton House USA


Holton House USA is a couture and ready-to-wear fashion design house that specializes in upscale Women's apparel. Based in scenic Charleston Sc, this brand seeks to bring high fashion to the closets of it's customers by offering not only couture designs but a line of affordable ready-to-wear pieces that invoke a timeless sense of style. Established in 2014 by designer and founder Noelle Stanley, the Spring/Summer 2016 Couture Line will be the first professional collection launched under the Holton House USA label. Holton House USA seeks to celebrate the history of style throughout the centuries; reinterpreting art and literature into sleek textile forms that are meant to compliment the female form. Redefining modern vintage is their key philosophy but passion, dedication and perseverance are the brick and mortar of this brand.
Ms. Stanley is a self-taught designer who first gained attention with her unique children's wear brand, Ambrosia Star Designs. As a top 20 Emerging Designer for Charleston Fashion Week 2014, she represented the only children's wear chosen to compete and received the People's Choice Award warranting glowing reviews from industry insiders. Ms. Stanley has expanded her horizons into women's wear and is determined to bring an artist view of form and function to the forefront of fashion-worldwide with this the inaugural collection of Holton House USA.
  www.facebook.com/HoltonHouse
Brandi Bowen with Ever So Lovely
Ever So Lovely is a design studio based out of Raleigh, North Carolina where artist and designer Brandi Bowen creates one of a kind jewelry inspired by both nature and found objects. Earning her BA in Graphic Design from Meredith College, Brandi loved all things tangible and design and sought time away from her job on the computer. Combining her love of vintage beads, hand cut and hammered metal, along with sparkly gemstones - she creates unique earrings inspired by a summer's starlight sky. Her Heavy Metal line of necklaces are sure to add a dose of sweetness or sarcasm to your day. And her most recent collection, Mersea and Moon, draws heavily on her love of nature and all things "Wild and Free" where she creates one of a kind necklaces and earrings highlighting birds in flight, diving sea turtles and jumping foxes. To see more of her work visit her website www.ShopEverSoLovely.com
Sarah Markusich with Autumn & Parr




Autumn & Parr is a custom and ready-to-wear
jewelry company that specializes in stunning silver work. Under the leadership
of founder and jewelry designer Sarah Markusich, Autumn & Parr has evolved
into a wealth-spring of creative energy, producing multiple lines of jewelry
that appeal to a wide range of consumers. 


Inspired by art, literature,
and the culture of multiple eras from various regions of the world, Sarah
blends each inspiration with handcrafted techniques to compliment her line.
From soft autumn hues that hold an earthy appeal, to the newly minted Bridal
collection of interwoven silver and pearls, this company seeks to bring out the
beauty of each element and the woman who is wearing it. Mrs. Markusich has
infused her own creative past as a nature lover, belly dancer, art history
major, and mother of two into each design in the Autumn & Parr collection.
In fact, Parr is Sarah's maiden name, to which she stated, “To move forward,
you build on your past and everything you've come to love.” www.autumnparr.com
Paris Team


ModelsAlexis Alexander, ShinHae Yoon, Tanis Beatty, Camie Ragsdale, Lexi Fonoimoana, Austin Olive, Samantha Peel, Mary Allen, Shivali Patel, Stefan Tesliuc, Elliot Kircher, Briana Graves, and Megan OlsonStaff/Writers/FOH/BOH/Photographers



Kourtney Hardin, Madison Moose-Barrington, Paige Tiller, Dawn Conner, Ozzy Ojito, and Leigh Moose
Hair & MUA


Kegan Dean-Rushing, Keiya Hinson, and Sergio Apaez Velasco


The Perks

Thank you Post Card ($15):
Thank you so much for being a part of our team! You will receive a hand written thank you post card with an image from The Project, from our designers.
Sponsor List ($30):
As part of our team, we would like to say thank you by adding you to our Sponsor List on all the designers and agents websites.
*If you are a business, we are happy to promote your link.
The Project Coffee Mug ($60):
The Project coffee mug featuring The Project image, from our designers.  12 ounce, 3 1/2" * 3 1/2"


The Project Tote Bag ($75):
Screen-printed 5 oz. 1"w * 14"h * 14.5"l cotton canvas tote bag featuring The Project image, from our designers.
   


Limited Edition T-shirt ($100):
A Limited Edition t-shirt featuring The Project image you will be proud to show off to your friends and family.

    

Holton House USA Scarf ($150):
One of a kind, handmade Infinity scarf by Holton House USA. These beautifully knitted scarves are 8" wide, 26" folded in half/52" total. They are made from acrylic thread, all USA sourced...extremely soft!  


Rings by Autumn & Parr ($250):
Handcrafted, sterling silver patterned bands that are perfect as knuckle rings, for stacking, or can be worn beautifully on their own from designer Sarah Markusich.

One (1) print of a
design sketch from designer Brenden M Comb’s Collection.  Limited edition run and numbered.  Print size measures 11x14 inches.  Museum-quality, acid-free white paper.

Signed Framed Limited Edition/Numbered Design Sketch ($2,500):

One (1) framed print of
a Zachary/Nathaniel design sketch.   Limited edition run & numbered. Frame 11x14
inches & 2 inch mat.  Museum-quality,
acid-free white paper.

Work with your choice of designer, Zachary Howell , Brenden M Combs or Noelle Stanley, on your custom gown made design.
** Collaboration with designer for your custom piece.  Fabric and detail items are at the discretion of the designer.

story:
Risk and Challenges

Why you can trust we'll deliver. Here's why - we have a great team that knows how to tool, manufacture and delivers silicone products. We've already produced the "small" size. We understand what Kickstarter is about and take our obligation to backers very seriously. Our medical device manufacturer that specializes in silicone is based in Southern California (20 minutes from our home office). So when you back us, you can trust this project will come to life. Don't hesitate to send us a message if you have any questions or concerns. 

All we need is your support!! Thanks in advance!

story:
Vidonn® PulseBand A6™ 

An intuitive, intelligent, cost-effective solution to support a better life style every day. 

Now Featuring An Advanced Heart Rate Monitor.

Vidonn® PulseBand A6, the smart wristband with a Heart.

  • Featuring a seamless and waterproof design, the PulseBand A6 offers a large OLED screen for an optimal display experience, delivering full caller ID and message notifications from text and social applications including Facebook, Snapchat, Twitter and WhatsApp. 
  • Equipped with one of the most advanced optical Heart Rate monitor module and algorithm on the market, PulseBand now monitors your heart rate right on your wrist to accurately track workout intensity, maximize training and optimize your health by providing both real-time readings and historical trend of your heart rate.
  • Collect real time data all day, complete with the new heart rate and an upgraded motion algorithm, to deliver the collect and compete with your friends, motivating you and others to push your goals. 
  • Integrated within the PulseBand A6, wirelessly sync your smartphone automatically and enhance your experience with the Vidonn app. 
  • Complete with full track records, chart displays, and target motivations encouraging you to compete and increase your score. 
  • Idle Alerts for reminding you to move after customized period of time when you sit still and do not move. 
  • Personalized display fonts ensure that your PulseBand A6 experience is unique, while the innovative battery and magnetic fast charging system guarantees long-lasting performance and super fast charging speeds. Get fully charged from empty in less than an hour. 
  • Continues to work even when you aren’t, monitoring your sleep cycles and patterns and delivering comprehensive results on your sleep quality. 

Improving your life one pulse at a time, all from a single high-end device with an affordable price

THE PRESS LOVE US, TOO.

Over the last 30 days, we have received an huge amount of recommendations and praise from many engaged backers and the fitness community. The awesome backers have all CRUSHED all expectations and goals set by our team. We could have never imagined the amount of support we have received. It is truly heartwarming!


Be Classy, Stay Stylish

Main Features

19 Reasons to Support PulseBand A6

  • Top quality at affordable prize
  • All day activity & fitness tracking
  • Advanced heart rate monitoring
  • Caller ID & Message Notifications Display
  • Moveless Reminder/ Idle Alert
  • Super compact light-weight design, only 0.68 oz (19g), providing real next-to-skin wearing comfort
  • Seamless design with ultrasonic joint welding technology for enhanced splashes waterproof
  • Personalize Time Display Fonts  
  • Long battery life lasts up to 1~2 weeks with innovative magnetic fast charging system 
  • Silent Alarms
  • To-the-point 0.88 in. OLED screen for optimal reading experience
  • Incoming caller & Message notification, check caller ID, Text Message, Twitter, Skype, What’s up, WeChat, Facebook and more
  • Smart sleep monitoring - Detect sleep quality, intelligently judge sleep status
  • APP enhancing - Real-time readings for exercise, sleep, full track record, chart display, target encouraging, rank encouraging, athletic competition encouraging and score encouraging with fun and enjoyment
  • Wireless syncing automatically to smartphones
  • Works perfectly with most of Android 4.3+ smartphones
  • Works perfectly with iOS 8 and above
  • Supports Apple® Health App  
  • Firmware wireless upgrading, easy error repair and function expanding



Product Comparison


#Update - January 29# The Heart Rate tracker has been tested among the most advanced heart rate trackers on the market. In order to provide a better understanding and visual, we have produced the following short clip demonstrating the accuracy compared to other wearable products:


#Update - February 1# Additionally, in our hopes to continue our own support to our backers, we have produced another short clip demonstrating the text display capabilities and clarity of the A6. You all must be getting use to our model's hand by now! 


Timeline


Reward Tiers

  • $1 - Support and Stay Connect! Thank you for showing your supports for our dream. It means a lot to every of us - We believe in bringing the best and the most reliable technology to everyone with an affordable price tag to match!

- Solo Pack -

  • $49 - Indiegogo Early Bird Special: 

    1x PulseBand A6 in any of the 4 colors + 1x Magnetic Charging Cable + App (MSRP $69.95 USD)

  • $59 - Indiegogo Special:

    1x PulseBand A6 in any of the 4 colors + 1x Magnetic Charging Cable + App (MSRP $69.95 USD)

- PairUp Pack -

  • $98 - Pair-Up Special:

    2x PulseBand A6 in any of the 4 colors + 2x Magnetic Charging Cable + App (MSRP $69.95 x 2 = $139.90 USD)

- TeamUp Pack -

  • $147 - Team-Up Special:
    3x PulseBand A6 in any of the 4 colors + 3x Magnetic Charging Cable + App (MSRP $69.95 x 3 = $209.85 USD)
- Family Pack -
  • $196 - Family Pack Special:

    4x PulseBand A6 in any of the 4 colors + 4x Magnetic Charging Cable + App (MSRP $69.95 x 4 = 279.80 USD)

- Bulk Pack  -
  • $449 - Retail Trial Pack:  10x PulseBand A6 in any of the 4 colors + 10x Magnetic Charging Cable + App: Thinking of selling A6 in your store? This trial pack is a great way to test customers’ responses. We’re confident they’ll be sold out in no time! Get 10 A6 in any color. (Retails for $700 USD)
  • $ 1,269 - Distributor Pack:  30x PulseBand A6 in any of the 4 colors + 30x Magnetic Charging Cable + App (Retails for $2,097 USD)

Click to view our Kickstarter Campaign


Why Crowdfunding?

We want EVERYONE to have the opportunity to benefit from the advanced technology and live a healthy life. We aim to bring the best and the most reliable technology with an affordable price tag to match. We believe that this is the best and most cost-efficient way for us to get our great product to the people who want it most: people like you.

Help us by sharing PulseBand A6 with your friends!

Know someone who would be just as stoked as you are about PulseBand A6? Share our campaign with them through the buttons on the left side at the top. Sharing is caring!

 

International Backers

We want more people to enjoy healthy living and benefit from technology. We will ship PulseBand A6 worldwide, with the exception of Argentina, Belarus, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, Myanmar/Burma, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, and Yemen. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

Estimated Delivery

Each reward tier may have a different estimated shipment month. While we do not expect these to change, it is possible that the estimated shipment month may shift. At anytime up until your smart band has been shipped, you may request a full refund by emailing hello@vidonn.us.

Warranty

We stand firmly behind our products. Each PulseBand A6 comes with a 30-day money back guarantee and minimum 1-year limited warranty. We believe in reputation brought by good service and aim to maintain a high-level customer service for all of our products.

Need help?

We're here for you. If you have questions at any time, during or after the campaign has closed, you can always reach us at hello@vidonn.us.

About Us

Vidonn Technology MA Team and Shenzhen Vidonn Information Co., is committed to manufacture and development of wearable devices, the team consists of 15 team members in China and 7 members in Massachusetts, United States. The team has accumulated years of experience with hardware and software development. We believe in bringing the best and the most reliable technology to everyone with an affordable price tag to match. With our deep understanding for the need of customers, we aim to be professional in providing smart solutions and amazing products for you.

We want to provide our customers with the top-notch customer service and built up our international team in Cambridge, MA in the year 2014. By standing firmly behind our products, you may embrace the new lifestyle with those you love, and enjoy the benefits of worry-free technology in health.

A letter to Kickstarter, where our story begins

We are back!

Last Spring, we wanted to provide the Kickstarter with a great product, developed from our own previous model with upgraded materials, algorithm and software. However, due to a misunderstanding our campaign was suspended by KS. Rather than giving up, we stuck together and put all of our efforts and time into an entirely new and improved product. As we promised, we are back now carrying our new smart wristband featuring an advanced heart rate monitoring technology. 

We love KS, and received hundreds of supporting emails from kickstarters last time. We’d like to express our great appreciation to all of you, which is why we have come back to launch this new product on KS.  

Thank you all for continuing this awesome journey with us!

Risks and challenges

All smart bands shown on this page and in the video were built on our production line. We're actively preparing to ramp up at the factory and are ready to see this campaign go big. We are all ready for this Kickstarter campaign!

Forecasting Risk

We have done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible.

Supply Chain Risk

We have built a very capable team who have worked in industry for years.

Terms and Conditions

We will ship PulseBand A6 worldwide, with the exception of Argentina, Belarus, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, Myanmar/Burma, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, and Yemen. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.

In the rare case that there are limited backers for a specific color, we may have to reconsider that color in production. We will contact you and you will have the full right to either change the color or receive a full refund.

The Product Comparison chart is for information purpose only. We collected the information from their online stores. All information correct as of Jan 20, 2016.

As we promised, we are back now carrying our new smart wristband featuring an advanced heart rate monitoring technology. 
We love KS, and received hundreds of supporting emails from kickstarters last time. We’d like to express our great appreciation to all of you, which is why we have come back to launch this new product on KS.  
 
Thank you all for continuing this awesome journey with us!

Risks and challenges
All smart bands shown on this page and in the video were built on our production line. We're actively preparing to ramp up at the factory and are ready to see this campaign go big. We are all ready for this Kickstarter campaign!
Forecasting Risk
We have done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible.
Supply Chain Risk
We have built a very capable team who have worked in industry for years.
Terms and Conditions
We will ship PulseBand A6 worldwide, with the exception of Argentina, Belarus, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, Myanmar/Burma, North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, and Yemen. Please note that you may be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region.
In the rare case that there are limited backers for a specific color, we may have to reconsider that color in production. We will contact you and you will have the full right to either change the color or receive a full refund.
The Product Comparison chart is for information purpose only. We collected the information from their online stores. All information correct as of Jan 20, 2016.

story:
Lufbery is an independent pocket watch company dedicated to making stunning pocket watches for the dapper man about town.

Our pocket watches are inspired by the pocket watches issued to the gentleman pilots of the Royal Flying Corps during the First World War.

Lufbery was founded by Stuart King when he failed to find a dapper pocket watch to wear on his wedding day. 

Lufbery Watches is named after the famous First World War airborne manoeuvre known as the Lufbery Circle.

Lufbery pocket watches are inspired by the pocket watches issued to the British pilots of the Royal Flying Corps during the First World War.

The Mark IV (issued in 1914) and Mark V (issued in 1916) pocket watches were the world’s first cockpit watches.

They were so highly regarded that they were the only item of equipment ordered to be retrieved from a stricken aircraft.

The style of our case and the design of our dial have both been shaped by these iconic watches.

We have named our collection of pocket watches the Mark VI to recognise the influence the Mark IV and Mark V have had on the design.

The Lufbery logo pays homage to the broad arrow stamped on all equipment that belonged to the British military.

The Mark IV and Mark V pocket watch had the arrow stamped on the back of their case.

Our first collection, the Mark VI collection, consists of five pocket watches. Each pocket watch has been named after a Royal Flying Corps airfield used during the First World War.

Named after the Royal Flying Corp's airfield in Doncaster, Yorkshire. The Lufbery Doncaster has a brushed stainless steel case and a white dial.

Named after the Royal Flying Corp's airfield in Montrose, Scotland. The Lufbery Montrose has a matte black case and a black dial.

Named after the Royal Flying Corps airfield at Shoreham, on the south coast of England. The Lufbery Shoreham has a gold plated case and a white dial.

Named after the Royal Flying Corps airfield at Uxbridge in west London. The Lufbery Uxbridge has a brushed steel case and a black dial.

Named after the Royal Flying Corps airfield in Andover, Hampshire. The Lufbery Andover has a matte black case and a white dial.

 At Lufbery we create elegant timepieces with high quality components. Our design process took six months as we wanted the pocket watches to be perfect.

The Lufbery pocket watch has a simple, beautifully designed, bespoke case. It is made from premium 316L stainless steel. The weight of the Lufbery is designed to convey a feeling of quality and strength whilst visually appearing refined.

The dial is the showpiece of any watch. Lufbery's beautiful dial pays homage to the dials of the original aviation pocket watches of the First World War.


We have used domed sapphire crystal glass to showcase the beauty of the dial. It is scratch resistant and made to last. 

The movement, the heart of the watch, is a Seiko VD78. Produced by a Japanese company, Seiko, which have a long track record of producing precise, reliable movements.

Each pocket watch comes with a 30cm chain with an attached T bar. Each chain is the same colour as the watch case.

My name is Stuart King and I founded Lufbery Watches after failing to find a dapper pocket watch for my wedding. I am a History teacher from Surrey, UK. I am married with one son.

Interested in writing about orbitkey? The link above might help! FAQProduct: How do i carry larger keys such as car keys?All Orbitkey orders include a detachable D-Ring to allow for larger items such as car keys, accessories and key fobs.Product: How many keys can I use?The Orbitkey can cater up to 7 standard keys. For anything that doesn’t fit, the Orbitkey also comes with a detachable D-Ring to allow for extra or larger items. Product: Will my keys fit the Orbitkey?As long as the hole on your key is greater than 4.0mm and the length of the key from the hole to the end is shorter than 62mm, your key will fit the Orbitkey. Please note that the hole does not have to be a round shape.
For any keys that doesn’t it on the Orbitkey, they can be attached to the D-ring that comes with every Orbitkey.
Product: Does version 2.0 accessories fit version 1.0 Orbitkey?
Yes, all version 2.0 accessories will still fit the version 1.0 Orbitkey.
Product: What are the dimensions of the Multi-tool?
The width is 17.5mm, length is 62.5mm and thickness is 2.0mm Designed to fit these bolt diameters: 1/4 inch - 6.35mm 5/16 inch - 8mm 3/8 inch - 9.5mm
Product: Is there a difference between the D-ring attachment for each style, and from version 1?
We have redesigned the D-ring that comes with the Leather range - it is slightly smaller, smoother and curvier around the edges to give that extra premium look on the leather Orbitkey. 
The Standard D-ring that comes with the Rubber and Canvas range is also still a whole lot smoother than version 1's D-ring but still has a similar shape and design. In saying that, both D-rings have been upgraded from version 1. 
 Perks: How, and when do I choose my preferred colour/style for my Orbitkey?
You will receive an email with the invite link to your Backerkit survey from support@s.backerkit.com AFTER 10 DAYS from the date of your order. In the survey, you'll be able to choose your preferred colour, add extra items, and update your details.Perks: How do I order additional accessories or Orbitkeys?We've setup a few different bundle packs in the perks on the right of the campaign. However if you were looking to add something different OR create a different combination of items, simply choose a base Orbitkey (canvas/rubber/leather) and you can add extra items through your Backerkit survey.   Shipping: When will I receive my Orbitkey?We aim to have manufacturing completed by end of December and have Orbitkey 2.0 sent to our fulfilment centre in Hong Kong. We hope to start shipping out orders by early January in the new year. We will keep all of our backers updated and be completely transparent with progress.
Shipping: What shipping method will you be using?All orders will be sent directly from our fulfilment centre located in Hong Kong. All orders will be shipped with tracking.

story:
My Story

Have you ever thought how your designed suite dress or pants was born and made, or who created it and how? Maybe you did, more likely you did not. Like everything else, there is a story behind it. And it is not a pretty one,

For a few years, I was the CEO of a fashion & retail company. I was surprised to see that the people in charge for fashion designing are far away from the glamour of the fashion world, as I would expect. They were more like the back stage workers rather than the actors on the stage. For me it came as a surprise. Fashion designers do the hard work behind the curtain but on numerous occasions receive no credit.  

It turns out that being a fashion designer is much more than difficult than you might imagine. Young designers spend most of their time fighting for their professional and business survival. Not glamorous at all.

Over time, I met many designers, all young, talented and very passionate about their work struggling to survive with limited chances if any. At some point, it hit me - there is a market failure in the fashion market, one that no one cares about.

Like climbing the Everest 

Being a designer is not a conscious decision, it's a passion, and it comes from the heart. Designers do not choose that line of work to become rich and make tons of money. Mostly, like other artists they crave for recognition. Driven by an Inner passion to create and become famous as result of their own creation

Once graduating, a fashion designer has two options.

Do it on his own or work for someone else.

Working for someone else as employees too turns them into small screws in a big machine. Something that kills the spirit of an artist and a designer. Instead of Creating and designing, the work turns into preforming and producing, following briefs and rules. Usually it comes along with minimum wage and the death of the dream as it fades away.

The second option is to become independent, only independency in the fashion industry is almost missioning impossible. Any independent business is hard. However, in a business such as Fashion designing were the owner is actually the business itself doing all by himself, it is twice as difficult

Being independent in the fashion design business Is a one man show requiring a fashion designer to do all on their own , weather they have the knowledge or not :  

·  Plan ·  Invent the collection ·  Design ·  Produce ·  ship ·  Sell ·  Build Price ·  Market

·  Advertise ·  Build a brand......


It is too much for most people even if they own all of the knowhow, which most people do not.  Especially when they are young, only just graduated. No wonder it's hard to succeed as an independent fashion designer.  One can be a great fashion designer but still struggle when it comes to inventory, cash flow, pricing and other aspects of the business and thus, fail. 

So young people, creative, passionate and filled with dreams find out real fast that there options in life are… a bit gloomy

They suffer, but we suffer too

This situation makes all of us lose. There are more global leading strong brands than local unique ones. We all pay more for expensive brands, getting more or less the same outfits as thousands of others around the globe. We get less creativity, hardy no innovation, smaller variety and, we pay more. Not to mention the fact that we kill the spirits of those young creative passionate people that have less freedom, if any at all, to create.

Freshionup.com started as a business idea but quickly implemented a social mission and is now much more. One can be great at fashion designing and still overload on the business side and fail. So even though we come from the fashion industry we still find the things those talented young fashion designers need to go through to to survive, not to mention succeed, Staggering.

Our Vision

Change the Market and market Structure of the fashion world.

Freshionup can make a real change in the structure of the fashion market. It can unload a big part of the burden of the "business side" from fashion designers, enabling them to build sustainable businesses, set creativity free, increase variety and make the fashion world better for all.

Freshionup creates a supportive business envelope for those fashion designers so they can focus on what they do best - Design fashion, sell their own products and brands and still make at least an ok business. We are not the Etsy of fashion designers. If at all, we are aGreen House of fashion sprouts giving a true and real chance for those young designers to succeed.

We trust they will. Given a chance to act on their strengthens – designing fashion, without the Burdon of running a business, makes their odds of success tremendously higher.

We can create a Breath of fresh air in the world of fashion.

It's a Journey we are starting now because we believe in the cause and we strongly believe it's important. Freshionup.com is already online, up and running. You can already visit us on www.freshionup.com , open an online shop, buy from designers, read the fashion designers' guidebook and the freshionup's blog. It is all there. We sure hope it will work. Are we sure? Yes, we believe it will and even in the worst-case scenario, if we only do well to few hundred young passionate fashion designers, helping them to stand on their feet, it is already worth it!  

Help us tell the world – "We Are Here"

We need to let all young fashion designers and fashion fans know they can join. We need your support in the marketing side. We need to cross a crucial mass of members to achieve our goals. That takes allot of efforts and financial resources.  

We will need around 120,000$ to do it right and that is what we are asking you to contribute. Help us make the fashion world a better place for its true pillars and talents. Together we can change the world of fashion as you know it, making it a better place for those who deserve it freecreativity of fashion designing from the claws of industrial owners and industry constrains.

Stairway to heaven

If we succeed in what we plan:

  1. The world will have fashion designers that are more independent and a huge     variety of new, fresh refreshing fashion items.
  2. Designers will receive a bigger piece of the incomes- they deserve it.
  3. Innovation in creativity - as Independent designers can really create, set their minds free and create new innovative things for all of us.
  4. The world of fashion will have many many small and special brands rather than few global strong highly priced commercial ones...

Let's build a community – The power of the crowd

Crowd is power. Crowd of designers is a magnificent creative power.  A community of independent fashion designers can share its knowledge, overcome problems, create young refreshing innovative fashion, and help all of us look better, feel better and dress better. Even Unique.

 We need to reach as many young fashion designers as possible and that is why we are here.

Thank you so much.

www.freshionup.com

story:
STORY

About me

I remember the advice of my fashion University friends telling me that in this economy, I was crazy to go down this path. They said that my discourse was utopian, that I was “shooting myself in the foot” and that “no one wants to hire someone who asks too many questions about ethics”.

They were right to some extent but it didn’t stop me. I had never done things like others and would not start to fall in line then. In stead, I would make them care and start asking questions too.



After studying fashion business marketing in Paris and entrepreneurship in London, I decided to make it my mission to spread the word about ethical fashion and to make it accessible as it clearly needed to be demystified.

I had always been good at putting outfits together and made it my mission to communicate sustainability in the fashion industry that way. That´s how I started Selectablestyle, which is a website where I curate products from sustainable fashion brands.


ABOUT

Selectablestyle

Selectablestyle is the go-to destination for ethical fashion first-timers. The website showcases sustainably and ethically made clothing, accessories and interior products, as well as online tools and resources to create awareness and help consumers make great purchasing decisions.


Browsers can discover products and designers, learn about the topic, share ideas with a community, and find places where to shop. Brands can gain visibility and reach new customers.


THE PROJECT


After receiving eight month of mentorship and support from the School for creative startups, my startup has been given the opportunity to be showcased at Makegood Festival in the creatively-buzzing exhibition space at the Old Selfridges Hotel in London, from May 30th until June 1st 2014.

What you will help me achieve is not small. Being part of Makegood festival  gives my startup the opportunity to be seen by the press, influential fashion and lifestyle professionals and the public.

Being a small startup, I don't often have the opportunity to advertise my website and get exposure. With this event, thousands of people will get to discover the Selectablestyle Experience in just one weekend and I want to make this experience the best it can be.

If it all goes well this could be a fantastic chance to make months of work finally pay off by having my work and the brands I support seen in the best light possible.


At Makegood, Selectablestyle will have a large booth, which I need to fill up with ethical fashion brands' products, posters, cards, devices and goodies.

The walls will have popping elements and visitors will be invited to go through a journey of what Selectablestyle offers and why ethical fashion brands need to be chosen over less ethical brands.



Why Indiegogo

I need to raise £654.00 to cover the cost of printing (posters, vinyls, experience cards and business cards, press leaflets), insurances, other materials (such as paint, MDF, DIY material), furnitures (shelves, see-through boxes, decorative objects), and the campaign fees for indiegogo and the payments provider.

The Indiegogo Campaign will release enough funding to make Selectablestyle Makegood showcase the best it can be, and if successful, it may help me develop future avenues for the website.


Understanding Costs

In case it goes really well

If we exceed the initial funding target, I will set stretch goals that will allow me to improve the ethical fashion guide and continue developing it. I will be able to purchase an amazing template for the blog to turn it into a community and I will be able to fund specific website new features such as an ethical fashion map.


In case it does not go so well

If I don't reach my goal I will be really, really sad, and so will be my display at Makegood Festival. I will have to downgrade my display and use what I have raised for a flat poster. I wont be able to display the products in the best light but will do my best to do them justice and I will be really thankful to those who helped make it happen.




Why is ethical fashion important?

The definition of ethical fashion might seem a little bit vague for many people. It is understandable as it is really personal. for some people it involves vegan materials and no animal testing, for other it's organic fabrics and recycled materials and for others it comes down to fair practices or reduced environmental impact.

For me ethical fashion is fashion done the right way, with maximum benefit for the people making them and the ones wearing them, as well as minimum impact to the environment.

It is actually a simple idea and yes, it might get difficult in practice but some bands like Toms, Monkee Genes,  Bottletop and many more manage to make it a reality. I believe that their amazing products deserve to be seen and that the big industry players can learn a lot from them. I want to give them exposure and by buying ethical fashion products, you are using your voice in one of the smartest way when it comes down to fashion choices. Be bold, embark on the Selectablestyle train and let's fill this world with better products, better jobs and better lives.




Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean that you can't help :).

You can get the word out and make some noise about my campaign on facebook or with a tweet. It will mean a lot to me! Simply tweet @selectablestyle #Makegood "...".

You can also follow Selectablestyle on social media, I appreciate all the love I can get!


Thank you!

I wont be able to display the products in the best light but will do my best to do them justice and I will be really thankful to those who helped make it happen.Why is ethical fashion important?
The definition of ethical fashion might seem a little bit vague for many people. It is understandable as it is really personal. for some people it involves vegan materials and no animal testing, for other it's organic fabrics and recycled materials and for others it comes down to fair practices or reduced environmental impact.For me ethical fashion is fashion done the right way, with maximum benefit for the people making them and the ones wearing them, as well as minimum impact to the environment.It is actually a simple idea and yes, it might get difficult in practice but some bands like Toms, Monkee Genes,  Bottletop and many more manage to make it a reality. I believe that their amazing products deserve to be seen and that the big industry players can learn a lot from them. I want to give them exposure and by buying ethical fashion products, you are using your voice in one of the smartest way when it comes down to fashion choices. Be bold, embark on the Selectablestyle train and let's fill this world with better products, better jobs and better lives.Other ways you can help
If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean that you can't help :). You can get the word out and make some noise about my campaign on facebook or with a tweet. It will mean a lot to me! Simply tweet @selectablestyle #Makegood "...".You can also follow Selectablestyle on social media, I appreciate all the love I can get!Thank you!
