Because we are proud supporters of STAND UP 2 CANCER!
For all Pleasure Pink colorways selected, 10% of all proceeds will be donated to a Cancer Research Agency (yet to be determined IF we get funded). Most of us know someone that has been or is affected by this awful disease. Lets all support this cause and STAND UP TO CANCER
___________________________________________________________________________________
100% RECYKIX (recycling program)

Don't throw away your used or unwanted CROSSKIX! 
At CROSSKIX, we are proponents of a 'Green Planet". Return 'em to us and we'll use for our RECY-KIX program. In return, we'll offer a 15% DISCOUNT on your next pair of CROSSKIX!
In addition, we want to donate some of the shoes to need kids and families around the world.
What sizes do we offer?
Whole sizes from 5-13 (including WOMENS)
All colorways are in FULL sizes (no half sizes needed).
click here to view SIZE CHART

_______________________________
How do I make a contribution or purchase a PERK?
Simply select from one (or two, or as many as you like) of the PERKS to the right of this page. Follow the prompts on how to finalize payment and you're done! Fast and Easy!
 
Thank you!
Special Thanks to NIKO CATABAY for producing the video..thanks for being patient and dedicated!

story:
EXTRINSIC 2 (the Sequel) 

A clothing Collection and short film 

by international Award Winner Daniel Hernandez.

Hello and thanks for taking the time to read this. My name is Daniel, I love music, fashion, photography and, most of all, entrepreneurship.

"EXTRINSIC 2" will be the second of five short films that will eventually compose a full-length movie. The project began last year and was well received by the public.  This is the story of my life as a fashion designer, which began in a third world country, in the middle of a war between the drug cartel of Colombia and the government, to immigrating to the United States at a young age, to having the opportunity to work and study in Paris next to some of the most influential people in the fashion industry, to my most recent adventure in Amsterdam where I won first place in a competition among over 800 designers from 72 countries. Recently I was awarded Avant-garde designer of the year by the New York Fashion Awards and finally got picked up by one store.

The purpose of this short film  is to empower other people who, like me, have come from difficult places and find themselves with no hope. I would like to share my story and, at the same time, create more work for the incredible group of fashion professionals with whom I currently work. I also find it essential to create more diversity within our local fashion community by creating new approaches to the way we present fashion.

It is my goal to engage the public with a compelling story that mixes fashion with some of the very sad times in history. The city of Medellin where I was born was one of the most dangerous places to live  during the early 1990's. Yet this situation did not stop me from dreaming big and making it to places in the world I never dreamed of. Passion for fashion and life is the message of "EXTRINSIC." 

Thanks for the opportunity to make one of my dreams come true. 

Enjoy life to the fullest!


Daniel.

Greetings Mammoth Fans!

You know what's up:

We've got sweet jackets - You need sweet jackets!

We really want to step up the quality on these, so we're launching an IndieGoGo campaign so that we can have the Mammoth logo embroidered on all our jackets.

And while we're at it, Stickers and Tshirts!

 

Wondering about jacket sizing? Here's a size chart!



Interested in customizing? Drop us a line and we'll see what we can do!

story:
Short Summary

We, Tune and Ulla Johansen, have invented a fire shelter that you can survive in during a bush fire. The fire shelter is tested above and beyond the Australian standards. Other shelters already on the market have either not been tested, or only tested to the Australian standard.

It is hard to believe that in 2016 we can send people to the moon but still have not protected ourselves against the very real and increasing threat of bush fires, even though more and more people live in rural areas. When you live in a rural area it is important to ensure that you and your family will be safe in the event of a bush fire. 

People loose their lives when caught in bush fires that are out of control, it just happened recently.This is avoidable through the use of non-toxic materials that has been used and tested over many years. Pumice is a natural insulator and we know it works, we are basically using nature’s own product to fight nature.


Our hope is that through this Indiegogo campaign, we will raise sufficient funds to obtain the Australian Standard Approval, technical drawings for the assembly of the fire shelter and further research. We aim for a simple and easy structure that is easy to build.

Photo of completed fire shelter painted by owner

This fire shelter has the potential to save lives in the bush fire zones, therefore it is important for us to get our product to the market as soon as possible.

What We Need & What You Get

Every dollar raised through this campaign is valued and all funds will go to Safety of the World, helping us to get this life saving fire shelter to the market. In return we will reward you with interesting photos and video footage from the test burn, as well as a sizable discount if you wish to place an order for our fire shelter. If we do not reach the full funding, we will start with obtaining the Australian Standard Approval. It is expensive but we are confident that our fire shelters can easily pass the test as it has already proven that our fire shelter works.


What we have done

Build the fire shelter in full (we do not believe you can say people can survive simply by testing a wall which is all the Australian Standards test require).

Tested to above 1000°C with steady internal temperatures (refer to the test results in the graphs below).

Invented a heat and fire proof door for the shelter.

Installed a small window (3 cm) to be used to check if the fire has passed and avoid the spread of panic in the room.

Tested the fire shelter in real life with a simulated bush fire around the shelter conducted by the Samsonvale Rural Fire Brigade, and measurements were recorded by a independent third party, Queensland University of Technology (QUT).

What we know

We know a bush fire on average runs for approximately 15 minutes and reach temperatures between 250°C and 450°C.

Firestorms reach above 1000°C for approximately 5 minutes and often travel at speeds between 120km/h and 140km/h.

Australian Standards require

The Australian Standards require: 

The testing of only one wall 3X3m with one fire door and one window

A fire proof door, with no requirement for it to be heat proof ( Our door is not only fire proof but also heat proof)

Reach 1000°C for 3 minutes only

As you can see we have tested our fire shelter above and beyond the Australian standards. We completed the test with exceptional results (see graphs below). It was a combined effort from the Samsonvale Rural Fire Brigade, Queensland University of Technology (QUT) and Safety of the World to ensure both accurate and independent data collection.


Interview with property owner in front of the tested fire shelter


Three graphs of our test results.

External Temperatures

On the External Temperature graph you can see we reach above 1000°C and the test ran for 135 minutes. 

Internal Wall



The Impact

We believe that this fire shelter has potential beyond imagination.

Our hope is that everyone living in a bush fire zone in Australia as well as the USA can get a fire shelter and not have to fear for their or their families’ life if they get caught in a bush fire.

During the design of the fire shelter we worked with a RPEQ certified engineer.

The Shelter is built on a strong steel frame under the heat and fireproof building blocks, and can withstand up to a magnitude three cyclone.

The design and construction has been completed so that customers can tailor their fire shelter to suit individual needs. The smallest do-it-yourself building kit is 3.2m(L)x2.7m(W)x2.7m(H) although as many extra sections (1.6m(L)x2.7m(H)) as needed can easily be purchased for expansion. All construction, including expansions, can be built without professional help, but once constructed approval is necessary by a building certifier.

The Fire Shelter has a few extra features worthwhile mentioning: 

- Double roof layer structure to withstand falling debris

 - Custom designed steel door that is the first on the market to be both heat AND fireproof

 - Window designed with glass utilised in atomic reactors to withstand temperatures of over 1600°C

 - Breathable air tanks with masks.  To avoid any dust or smoke in the air.

The fire shelter kit includes:

- The steel for the frame

- The building blocks

- 1 small window (additional available for purchase)

- The breathable air tanks and masks (supplied for 6 people, with additional available for purchase) 

- Materials for the door 

- Roof panels

- Brick glue 

- 2 boxes of nail-in plugs (approximately 2000 nail-in plugs)

Not included in the fire shelter kit: 

- Labour 

- Concrete slab 

- Certification 

- Shipping  

- Rendering (to make the fire shelter water proof (optional))


 

Risks & Challenges

Even the most perfect projects face risk and challenges.

- The biggest challenge and risk for us is that we do not obtain adequate funding to keep our project going.  

- The next challenge will be the Australian Standard, and regulations. 

- Convince the media, politicians and the Australian Standard Board that the standards for building fire shelters should be raised as our shelter exceed the current standards. In our fire shelter people trapped in a bush fire can survive if they follow the directions provided with the shelter. 

- A user-friendly manual must also be made to avoid incorrect construction and allow shelters to perform as well as tested.

These are some of the risks and challenges we can overcome with your support.


Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any help we can get. 

Funding is great, but we would also appreciate if you share our Indiegogo campaign or like us on Facebook. We value any word of mouth and recommendations you will give us. Please talk about us on twitter or social media and tell your family and friends who may be interested in this fire shelter.

Thank you for your support.

story:
Our campaign has ended, but you can still order by clicking the image below and you will be redirected to our website.


THE ULRIKEN COLLECTION

 
​After having had many fashion watches over the years that didn't live up to my expectations, I decided to take matters into my own hands and create the ultimate fashion watch under $500! I wanted to create a timepiece that would look elegant on your wrist, show the time and last in both design and quality. That is why every BERG watch comes with a 5 year warranty!

The Ulriken comes in 3 sizes, 36 mm, 38 mm, 40 mm. Choose between a Rose gold, gold or silver case.

The recommended case size for females are 36 mm and 38 mm

                                    Interchangeable straps

I don't want you to buy a new watch every 2 year, that is why every BERG watch comes with a 5 year warranty. Instead I want you to be able to create a new watch to fit any setting, by being able to switch the straps in just a few seconds. It is easy and makes it feel like you got a whole new watch.
 

                          Inspired by the raw nature of Norway

The contrast between the roughness of the strap and the simple and elegant design of the watch is what makes BERG a truly unique timepiece.

As my inspiration comes from my hometown Bergen, which is surrounded by seven mountains, it was only natural that the first collection would be named after the tallest one, Ulriken. Bergen is a UNESCO world heritage city with a long history of trade and fishing. It is also the rainiest city in Europe, so the watches needed to be water resistant.

  

                             SALMON LEATHER STRAPS

Salmon leather from Europe's finest tannery

When creating a timepiece with salmon leather straps it was important to me that the craftsmanship behind the strap reflected the quality of the watch. The tannery I ended up working with was ranked the #1 tannery in Europe in 2016 and is located on Iceland. The salmon skin that is used come from the Faroe Islands where it used to be a waste product, but is now being used in every BERG watch strap. The straps have a snap solution which makes it easy to change in just a couple of seconds.

                                        THE SPECIFICATIONS

Norwegian design - Swiss quartz movement - Salmon leather straps from Iceland - Sapphire glass - 5 ATM - 5 year warranty - Interchangeable straps - Stainless steel case - Sizes: 36mm, 38mm and 40 mm -  Choose between a rose gold, gold or silver case - Super slim case (8mm) - Choose between a white or a black dial - Ultra light.        

The straps come in black, brown, oxblood, dark green, grey and navy blue.

Expected delivery of your watch is in July. Production has already started and you will be among the first to receive your watch!

story:
Introducing LUX:

When we decided on the name LUX for our brand, we liked it because it meant 'light'.

Light - as in light from a bulb or the sun.  

So, hi there, we are purveyors of organic cotton period undies (amongst other things) and secretly quite proud of our creations. 

OUR JOURNEY:
Its been an interesting switch from the fast paced world of Finance, to the even faster paced world of consumer goods.
 
But the brilliant thing here is the degree and level of interactions I have directly with our consumers. I LOVE IT!! 
 
My objective is quite simple, to be the change and persuade you too.
As simple as all that. 
I am super excited about this campaign and hope that you will journey with me, here on out. 
 
 

 

PLASTIC POLLUTION:

Is not as widely acknowledged as it should be. 

We saw a mini revolution around people ditching the single use plastic straw, a few years back. But did you know the average period product, a period pad or tampon is a single use plastic product too?

This way these products 'always' stay around polluting the planet.

THE ECONOMICS OF YOUR PERIOD MAY NOT BE EQUITABLE:

How LUX Undies serve you:

LUX undies will dutifully absorb blood, sweat and pee. 

When you use an organic cotton period product like ours, you save your intimates from consistent exposure to plastic products. 

Consistent exposure to plastic has the ability to mess with a key hormone in women, oestrogen. Oestrogen is to women what an engine is to a train. Any imbalance will take a woman's body to a different destination.

There is published research (one of the very few) on this, we will pop it in the FAQs.

The mechanics of manufacturing..

..is straightforward. Our manufacturing team takes awesome organic ingredients and sews them together, in India. All employees at our factories are adults with the right to vote (so definitely no little fingers), who are offered fair wages. 

During the Covid -19 crisis, these workmen and women were offered 3 months of advance pay, given room and board and supported adequately. 

So pick a size that fits you, safe in the knowledge that no little finger(s) were involved, no reference to the chap from GAME OF THRONES, although he was not involved either.

Let us tell you how simple it is to use the LUX Undies:

Sorry if it seems like I am 'teaching grandma to suck eggs'. You may already know how to wear an undie, but why take the chance?

When your period starts, simply remove the undies from its pouch, wear it and go about your day as normal. LUX period undies are perfect on their own, to support the wearer through their periods.

For dutiful dads buying these for their daughter's first period, I have your back! 

 

 TESTIMONIALS:

Straight from the women who have used our undies. 

 
 
Listed below, you will find the summary of our perks. Please know, that we are ever so grateful for your support and look forward to welcoming you to our community.
 
 
Your pledges...
 
..mean the world to us. We are a small enterprise with big ambition. We are passionate about the products we have created and the feedback we have received from the women who have used them has filled us with joy. 
 
If we (that would be me and my long suffering husband and our lovely marketing director Sue) had our way, we would hire a car and a megaphone and drive around telling the world, or at least our little corner of London, why women should be making the switch.
 
We fear though, that we may miss out on all those folks, plugged into their phones, browsing for products online.
 
And that is why we need some nifty bit of online PR, so we can tell more people about how grand our undies are. This will cost us money and that's where we will initially direct money from your pledges to. After we have safely dispatched your undies to you first.
 
 
 
My decision to become a social entrepreneur, was driven by the deep seated need to create a positive legacy for my business.
 
For every pair of undies I sell, I will plant one tree. I will do this, for every pledge (for a period undie) we receive too. This will be done through our able partners Tree-Nation.
 
Our business is also proudly part of the Plastic Pollution Coalition, an advocacy group against the use of single use plastic.  
 

So come BE THE CHANGE YOU WISH TO SEE.  Every contribution helps, come pledge with us or help spread the word about us, through various social channels. If you are someone affiliated with the press or media or a radio channel, please get in touch with me and I will happily tell you more about my ambitions for my little brand. 

I look forward to welcoming you into our community and being of service.

Is not as widely acknowledged as it should be. We saw a mini revolution around people ditching the single use plastic straw, a few years back. But did you know the average period product, a period pad or tampon is a single use plastic product too?This way these products 'always' stay around polluting the planet.THE ECONOMICS OF YOUR PERIOD MAY NOT BE EQUITABLE:

How LUX Undies serve you:LUX undies will dutifully absorb blood, sweat and pee. When you use an organic cotton period product like ours, you save your intimates from consistent exposure to plastic products. Consistent exposure to plastic has the ability to mess with a key hormone in women, oestrogen. Oestrogen is to women what an engine is to a train. Any imbalance will take a woman's body to a different destination.There is published research (one of the very few) on this, we will pop it in the FAQs.The mechanics of manufacturing....is straightforward. Our manufacturing team takes awesome organic ingredients and sews them together, in India. All employees at our factories are adults with the right to vote (so definitely no little fingers), who are offered fair wages. During the Covid -19 crisis, these workmen and women were offered 3 months of advance pay, given room and board and supported adequately. So pick a size that fits you, safe in the knowledge that no little finger(s) were involved, no reference to the chap from GAME OF THRONES, although he was not involved either.Let us tell you how simple it is to use the LUX Undies:Sorry if it seems like I am 'teaching grandma to suck eggs'. You may already know how to wear an undie, but why take the chance?When your period starts, simply remove the undies from its pouch, wear it and go about your day as normal. LUX period undies are perfect on their own, to support the wearer through their periods.For dutiful dads buying these for their daughter's first period, I have your back!   TESTIMONIALS:Straight from the women who have used our undies.  


 
Listed below, you will find the summary of our perks. Please know, that we are ever so grateful for your support and look forward to welcoming you to our community.
 

 
Your pledges...
 
..mean the world to us. We are a small enterprise with big ambition. We are passionate about the products we have created and the feedback we have received from the women who have used them has filled us with joy. 
 
If we (that would be me and my long suffering husband and our lovely marketing director Sue) had our way, we would hire a car and a megaphone and drive around telling the world, or at least our little corner of London, why women should be making the switch.
 
We fear though, that we may miss out on all those folks, plugged into their phones, browsing for products online.
 
And that is why we need some nifty bit of online PR, so we can tell more people about how grand our undies are. This will cost us money and that's where we will initially direct money from your pledges to. After we have safely dispatched your undies to you first.
 

 

 
My decision to become a social entrepreneur, was driven by the deep seated need to create a positive legacy for my business.
 
For every pair of undies I sell, I will plant one tree. I will do this, for every pledge (for a period undie) we receive too. This will be done through our able partners Tree-Nation.
 
Our business is also proudly part of the Plastic Pollution Coalition, an advocacy group against the use of single use plastic.  
 
So come BE THE CHANGE YOU WISH TO SEE.  Every contribution helps, come pledge with us or help spread the word about us, through various social channels. If you are someone affiliated with the press or media or a radio channel, please get in touch with me and I will happily tell you more about my ambitions for my little brand. I look forward to welcoming you into our community and being of service.

story:
Translations:  Français  |  Español  |  Português | 

 

Designed for Fitbit, Garmin and other major fitness trackers, Bellafit is a stylish bracelet to be worn over wearables enhancing their appearance. Works on a one motion lock and unlock function and protects against scratches while giving full access to the tracker display.

Made with the highest quality Nickel Free, Hypoallergenic Brass and coated in 14K Gold and Palladium, Bellafit is a stunning piece of jewelry of the highest quality, pushing the boundaries of style and fitness wearables. 

In the ideation phase of our project, we considered designing something that concealed the tracker. Ultimately however, we realized that owning a fitness tracker gives the wearer a sense of pride. It's a statement about health and fitness goals, and we didn't want to compromise that. We wanted our design to complement the fitness tracker, not conceal it.

 

Art for your wrist

We have designed Bellafit to be a gorgeous piece of sleek yet structural jewelry. It can even be worn without your fitness tracker. The spacious dimensions of the Bellafit ensure it feels light and comfortable for the wearer, with or without the fitness tracker.

 

Easy to wear

Bellafit can be put on and taken off with just a flick of one hand so you don't have to fuss when you're heading back to the office after your lunchtime workout.

 

Accessible display

View your display and check your steps at any time while wearing your Bellafit. 

 

3 Colors

Bellafit is available in three timeless metallic hues, giving the wearer a multitude of style and color combinations to choose from. 

 

 

3 Models

In order to make sure Bellafit suits the widest range of fitness trackers possible we have developed 3 different models:

Choose Your Model

The three Bellafit models, work with 23 trackers on the market as of the start of this campaign. Follow our guide below and match your fitness tracker to the Bellafit for you.

 

Choose Your Size

We offer Bellafit in two sizes, Small and Large. To know which size is right for you, download and print our size band below. Make sure to adjust the size band based on how you like to wear your tracker.  If the arrow lands on the S bar, then the small will best suit you. If it lands on the L bar, then the large size will best suit.

KEY: Make sure to print the size band at 100%, otherwise you will not get an accurate result for your Bellafit size. 

 

Choose the reward for you from the list below. Once the campaign is over, you will select details such as size, color, model etc and you will be given an additional chance to add rewards or extras via a very easy to use survey.

The BELLAFIT 

If you've read this far you know what this reward is. Back this on InDemand and get the best discounts on our Retail Price. No need to worry about color, model or size now. You will be able to select all that on our survey after the campaign ends. We will make this process really simple.

The Gift Package

We haven't forgotten the boys. For all you adoring husbands, fathers, sons, boyfriends, brothers etc, this reward is for you. Show the amazing women in your life how much you value them with the gift of a Bellafit. This reward comes with special packaging and a greeting card that reads "I thought about you, I hope you love this".

The Bundles

You can't get enough of Bellafit and you want one in every color, or 3 in every color. Most likely though, you have a bunch of friends who also want a Bellafit. Or you have a Retail Store and you have very savvy customers who would adore a Bellafit. Our Bundle rewards are for you guys.

We hope you love Bellafit as much as we're enjoying this journey. Just in case you can't get enough, check out some color combinations we had fun with over the last few months.

We started thinking about Bellafit in February 2015, but it wasn't until last year when we met the supremely talented Angie Kim, that we really started to zone in on the design. Bellafit today complements the wearable device, fits a large variety of fitness trackers, is easy to put on and take off and still, remains a truly iconic design.

One year of design exploration, engineering, prototyping, refining later and the result is the structural, artistic, sleek and polished design you see today.

Karen Whelan: CEO. 5 years’ experience in online marketing, international shipping and product development, Karen is currently working at a leading technology company based in Luxembourg.

“My favourite part about working on the Bellafit project has been working with this team. They’re totally nuts. One day, I’ll share the outtakes from our videoshoot with Angie, or the screenshots I’ve taken of Carlos' attempts at "bluesteel" on one of our million video calls, or a list of the “that’s what she said” jokes that Julien manages to insert into every single business call. But until that time comes, just see them as superstars in their fields of expertise! They work so hard, they are warm, kind people.”  

Carlos Martin: Advisor. Carlos worked in Shenzhen for almost 10 years as a product engineer, and is currently working at PCH Lime Lab in San Francisco. He has almost 20 years of experience of bringing products from design to manufacturing.  

¨When my friend Karen told me about her idea I didn´t hesitate to help her bringing her dream product to market. It is great to work with good friends, even when they are a crazy Irish-French couple!"

Julien Morel: Engineering Advisor. Julien has worked as an engineer in France, Italy, China and South America. Julien is our enforcer. His favorite task is hounding our suppliers to make sure they’re on top of their deadlines.  

“We had just completed a Trail Run in the hills of Hong Kong and were having a well deserved drink on the terrace of a restaurant when Karen announced her idea for Bellafit. I instantly recognized the unshakable determination of my wife and I knew this project would come to life. Two years later, and Bellafit is about much more than a product. Bellafit speaks to active women who no longer need to worry about compromising their style in order to achieve their fitness goals"

Angie Kim: Chief Designer. Angie has worked for over a decade as an industrial designer, largely at the renowned design consultancy IDEO in San Francisco. She is also an accomplished entrepreneur and founder of AYK. A Kickstarter Campaign.

"They're awesome. What else could I say about co-founders who are incredibly passionate about their product and have been able to bring an idea to life in the past 2 years amidst geographical moves, raising children, big life milestones, and having full time jobs. They are one of the most committed teams I've been graced by and an absolute joy to work with."

Marie Martin: Marie has played an integral role in this project by helping the team to remain focused and prioritize when it wasn't always easy to do so. She has a keen aesthetic eye and provides extremely valuable perspective and critique. She is also a very talented entrepreneur. Watch this space for a super exciting project that Marie has been developing for the past 12 months. 

 

Help us by Sharing Bellafit with your friends!

Know someone who would be just as excited as you are about Bellafit? Share our campaign with them using any of the Social Media buttons below. Sharing is caring!

 

Risks and challenges

 

Our team has extensive experience in making products and the logistics of international shipping. There are always challenges but we’ve always managed to overcome them in the past and delivered on our projects and we feel very confident that this experience will allow us to successfully deliver for our Bellafit backers. We have done and will continue to do our best to ensure that our cherished Bellafit backers receive exactly what we’ve promised.

Part of why it took us over two years to get campaign ready is because we were selecting the best partners to work with. We are collaborating with reputable and qualified manufacturing partners with factories ready to start production. We believe that we have set realistic and reasonable estimated delivery dates and as such, we anticipate that it will be a fairly smooth process if our project is funded.

Taxes and charges are not included in the cost of shipping your Bellafit.

The Bellafit is not an official product of Fitbit®, Garmin®, Sony®, Polar® or Xiaomi®.

Fitness Tracker is not included.

Not recommended to wear while exercising or sleeping.

story:
The Problems

The founder of K.O.M. Apparel looked at the current cycling apparel market and saw three problems; 

  1. Design
    • Current cycling apparel brands are out of touch when it comes to designing product for riders. Design are repetitive and unoriginal, and where is the riders input? Custom designs are possible, but when custom orders are created, quality is often sacrificed to balance design costs, and customers must often meet unreasonable and unrealistic minimum order quantity rules. 
  2. Cost
    • Cycling apparel in general is expensive, especially as the quality of the product increases. Top and bottom pairs (kits) can reach $500+ dollars when reaching the long lasting and comfort level of professional apparel. Part of this cost is due to companies forecasting and carrying stock of their items, needing to then sell certain quantities at certain prices in order to maintain profit. Forecasting is difficult, and incurs costs then passed onto the customer.
  3. Purpose
    • Not only is cycling apparel expensive, but for what purpose? To pay company salaries and go back into the company to sponsor professional teams with new toys? Customers should know their purchase is going towards more than that, and corporate entities should be held to higher socially conscious standards than profit in their sales.

Our Solutions

Problems are opportunities for innovation, and that's exactly how K.O.M. Apparel approached improving the cycling apparel market for the consumer. The relationship we will hold with the customer is unlike any other cycling apparel brand, and we kept that ideal close to heart when developing our company's solutions;

  1. Design
    • Get users in on the design process! With our model, apparel designs are provided by the users in a crowdsourcing platform. Customers submit designs, and their vote will also determine which kit is put into production. No longer will the opinions of corporate heads and acclaimed designers solely speak for the people.
  2. Cost
    • One of our largest advantages is never carrying regular stock of our custom apparel. Everything is pre sold, meaning we will never forecast and order a quantity of product ahead of time, that we then need to sell in order to assure profit. As a result, no costs are incurred by storing and stocking custom apparel.
  3. Purpose
    • Not only is our apparel high quality and less expensive because of our business model, but our apparel can be purchased for a reason beyond consumerism. K.O.M. Apparel prides itself in maintaining numerous partnerships with nonprofit organizations, allowing users to donate a dedicated portion of proceeds from their purchase to a partner of their choice. Beyond revenue and profitability, our brand offers a social aspect as well.

What We Need

We have secured a manufacturer, tested our supply chain, and brought real product to real people. Up until this point, financing efforts have been through the bootstrapping efforts of our founder, and now we're asking for your help. This campaign holds the goal of $10,000, and we have some very specific places your contribution will go. Our last barriers to full scale market entry are all about improving user experience. Final packaging and labeling goods, a space to safely hold our product before final shipment to customers, and our e-commerce costs are all specifically budgeted items your contribution makes possible.

  1. Packaging & labeling, printed goods
    • As our company's full launch approaches, our absolute goal is to provide the best user experience possible. Beyond our standards of customer service and revolutionary customer relationship formation, we believe in providing for you down to the finest details. These details include the last touches of handwritten letters, beautiful tags, and other printed goods to be included in users shipments.
  2. Workspace
    • As highlighted in our problem solutions, K.O.M. Apparel has eliminated the need for true product warehouses and storage facilities. We are proud of the savings this allows us to provide riders. We do, however, still need one small facility to assure product quality and allow the hand packaging of purchases by our staff.
  3. E-commerce 
    • K.O.M. Apparel is an entirely e-commerce based brand, meaning we maintain no physical storefront for our business. As a result, we are able to provide for a significantly larger population of riders, and implement our process of crowdsourcing and user voting. The funds of our founders have allowed the development of our e-commerce platform, and it is your final contribution that will allow our full scale, public launch.

Those are the specific places your backing will go, all in our mission to provide high quality cycling apparel with a personally designed touch and give users a reason for their purchase other than corporate profit. Crowdsourcing designs, user voting, and partnerships with nonprofit organizations to donate a percentage of proceeds - that's what we're about, and that's what you make possible.

What You Get

As campaign backers, you have a variety of rewards and perks to select, ranging from "immortality" to full apparel packages, and even the opportunity to collaborate and design the first public kit of K.O.M. Apparel.

1. Immortality (of sorts)

  • Immortality?! A public page of our website will forever be dedicated to the backers of this campaign, filled with their names, eternalizing them for all of time. Backers of this reward will also receive a handwritten letter from the Founder of K.O.M. Apparel.

2. Nonprofit Donation & Cap

  • Aligning with our nonprofit partnerships, select this reward and donate to Back on My Feet. This organization provides employment and stable housing opportunities to the homeless through running. Also, you will receive a limited edition K.O.M. Apparel cycling cap.

​

3. Patch, Drink, Snack and Strava

  • Make us work for it! Receive an iron-on patch, a snack from Barnana, and 1lb of coffee provided by Stone Creek Coffee. Also, for every backer of this level, our founder will ride 2 miles, and prove it to you through Strava. Yes, we know it's about to be winter in Wisconsin... Ride on!
    • Noah Stamsta's Strava

​​

4. Limited Edition Jersey

  • Receive a high quality, limited edition jersey from K.O.M. Apparel available only during this campaign. Select from one of the two designs, both available in men's and women's cut.
    • Sizing Chart

​

5. Jersey Voucher & Letter

  • Not interested in the design we're offering, but love the idea of our company? We'll always be coming out with new designs. Select this option, and receive a handwritten letter and redeemable coupon code to use in the future. Stop by our website once we launch, and redeem your pre-purchased jersey.

6. Limited Edition Kit

  • You will receive the high quality, limited edition jersey from K.O.M. Apparel, and also the matching bottoms (bibs or shorts) to complete the exclusive ensemble. Select from one of the two designs, both available in men's and women's cut, shorts or bibs.
    • Sizing Chart

​

7. Kit Voucher & Letter

  • Not interested in the design we're offering, but love the idea of our company? We'll always be coming out with new designs. Select this option, and receive a handwritten letter and redeemable coupon code to use in the future. Stop by our website once we launch, and redeem your pre-purchased kit (jersey and bottoms).

8. Summer Package

  • What do all cyclists need in the Summer? A great kit, a breathable baselayer, a snack, and fresh coffee. Receive all of that in this exclusive package, snack provided by Barnana and coffee provided by Stone Creek Coffee.

9. Winter Package

  • What do all cyclists need in the Winter? A great kit, some matching arm warmers, a snack, and a warm cup of coffee. Receive all of that in this exclusive package, snack provided by Barnana and coffee provided by Stone Creek Coffee.

10. One of Everything, Please

  • You want the full spread; a full, limited edition kit, a breathable baselayer, a cycling cap, the iron-on patch, and a 5lb bag of Stone Creek Coffee. Also, we'll make a donation to the nonprofit organization Back on My Feet, helping it's members move their lives towards stable housing and employment ($25).

11. Collaborator's Package

  • This is the big one. You will work directly with K.O.M. Apparel to create one of the designs for the Public Launch of our brand. Collaboration, plus everything listed in the "One of Everything, Please" package. Also, we'll get you a pair of custom, handpainted Fizik R1B's, handpainted by Simon Fellows of Artful Kicks.

The Impact

So, why back us? We give our users a voice in the product and design they receive, and not only do we give our users a voice, but users can feel incredibly positive in the voice they have with K.O.M. Apparel. More than with any other company, the opinion of our customers is heard, and due to the contributions their purchase makes to our nonprofit partners, is an opinion worth voicing. Help us become a reality, and know you helped a University of Wisconsin - Whitewater student realize his dream of providing riders with high quality, crowdsource designed cycling apparel while donating to meaningful nonprofit causes.

Risks & Challenges

As with any startup, there are associated risks and challenges with our progress. Our goal from the beginning has be to eliminate and minimize the risks and challenges our team will face, and we have with great success. Manufacturing logistics, gender differences in our apparel lines, ease of website use, and nonprofit partnerships all came with associated hurdles (or barricades, you cyclocross junkies) our founder overcame.  At K.O.M. Apparel, we believe one of our biggest challenges to be brand outreach and user engagement. Putting our name onto the radar of riders is of the utmost importance, and it is what will allow our entire crowdsourcing and donation platform to thrive. Luckily, in talking with incredible mentors available at the University of Wisconsin - Whitewater, and such successful crowdsourcing business founders as Henry Schwartz at MobCraft Beer, our team is confident in our ability to meet these challenges. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We mentioned a potential challenge of user engagement, and that's where you come in. Whether you can or are willing to donate, sharing our campaign and brand is something everyone can take part in. If you believe in our movement, take a moment to share, tweet, forward, link... anything our campaign. At the top of this campaign page, Indiegogo features simple to use sharing tools.

Thank you, and we at K.O.M. Apparel are eager to begin our progress together.

Up until this point, financing efforts have been through the bootstrapping efforts of our founder, and now we're asking for your help. This campaign holds the goal of $10,000, and we have some very specific places your contribution will go. Our last barriers to full scale market entry are all about improving user experience. Final packaging and labeling goods, a space to safely hold our product before final shipment to customers, and our e-commerce costs are all specifically budgeted items your contribution makes possible.


Packaging & labeling, printed goodsAs our company's full launch approaches, our absolute goal is to provide the best user experience possible. Beyond our standards of customer service and revolutionary customer relationship formation, we believe in providing for you down to the finest details. These details include the last touches of handwritten letters, beautiful tags, and other printed goods to be included in users shipments.


WorkspaceAs highlighted in our problem solutions, K.O.M. Apparel has eliminated the need for true product warehouses and storage facilities. We are proud of the savings this allows us to provide riders. We do, however, still need one small facility to assure product quality and allow the hand packaging of purchases by our staff.


E-commerce K.O.M. Apparel is an entirely e-commerce based brand, meaning we maintain no physical storefront for our business. As a result, we are able to provide for a significantly larger population of riders, and implement our process of crowdsourcing and user voting. The funds of our founders have allowed the development of our e-commerce platform, and it is your final contribution that will allow our full scale, public launch.


Those are the specific places your backing will go, all in our mission to provide high quality cycling apparel with a personally designed touch and give users a reason for their purchase other than corporate profit. Crowdsourcing designs, user voting, and partnerships with nonprofit organizations to donate a percentage of proceeds - that's what we're about, and that's what you make possible.
What You Get
As campaign backers, you have a variety of rewards and perks to select, ranging from "immortality" to full apparel packages, and even the opportunity to collaborate and design the first public kit of K.O.M. Apparel.
1. Immortality (of sorts)
Immortality?! A public page of our website will forever be dedicated to the backers of this campaign, filled with their names, eternalizing them for all of time. Backers of this reward will also receive a handwritten letter from the Founder of K.O.M. Apparel.
2. Nonprofit Donation & Cap
Aligning with our nonprofit partnerships, select this reward and donate to Back on My Feet. This organization provides employment and stable housing opportunities to the homeless through running. Also, you will receive a limited edition K.O.M. Apparel cycling cap.
​
3. Patch, Drink, Snack and Strava
Make us work for it! Receive an iron-on patch, a snack from Barnana, and 1lb of coffee provided by Stone Creek Coffee. Also, for every backer of this level, our founder will ride 2 miles, and prove it to you through Strava. Yes, we know it's about to be winter in Wisconsin... Ride on!Noah Stamsta's Strava

​​
4. Limited Edition Jersey
Receive a high quality, limited edition jersey from K.O.M. Apparel available only during this campaign. Select from one of the two designs, both available in men's and women's cut.Sizing Chart

​
5. Jersey Voucher & Letter
Not interested in the design we're offering, but love the idea of our company? We'll always be coming out with new designs. Select this option, and receive a handwritten letter and redeemable coupon code to use in the future. Stop by our website once we launch, and redeem your pre-purchased jersey.
6. Limited Edition Kit
You will receive the high quality, limited edition jersey from K.O.M. Apparel, and also the matching bottoms (bibs or shorts) to complete the exclusive ensemble. Select from one of the two designs, both available in men's and women's cut, shorts or bibs.Sizing Chart

​
7. Kit Voucher & Letter
Not interested in the design we're offering, but love the idea of our company? We'll always be coming out with new designs. Select this option, and receive a handwritten letter and redeemable coupon code to use in the future. Stop by our website once we launch, and redeem your pre-purchased kit (jersey and bottoms).
8. Summer Package
What do all cyclists need in the Summer? A great kit, a breathable baselayer, a snack, and fresh coffee. Receive all of that in this exclusive package, snack provided by Barnana and coffee provided by Stone Creek Coffee.
9. Winter Package
What do all cyclists need in the Winter? A great kit, some matching arm warmers, a snack, and a warm cup of coffee. Receive all of that in this exclusive package, snack provided by Barnana and coffee provided by Stone Creek Coffee.
10. One of Everything, Please
You want the full spread; a full, limited edition kit, a breathable baselayer, a cycling cap, the iron-on patch, and a 5lb bag of Stone Creek Coffee. Also, we'll make a donation to the nonprofit organization Back on My Feet, helping it's members move their lives towards stable housing and employment ($25).
11. Collaborator's Package
This is the big one. You will work directly with K.O.M. Apparel to create one of the designs for the Public Launch of our brand. Collaboration, plus everything listed in the "One of Everything, Please" package. Also, we'll get you a pair of custom, handpainted Fizik R1B's, handpainted by Simon Fellows of Artful Kicks.

The Impact
So, why back us? We give our users a voice in the product and design they receive, and not only do we give our users a voice, but users can feel incredibly positive in the voice they have with K.O.M. Apparel. More than with any other company, the opinion of our customers is heard, and due to the contributions their purchase makes to our nonprofit partners, is an opinion worth voicing. Help us become a reality, and know you helped a University of Wisconsin - Whitewater student realize his dream of providing riders with high quality, crowdsource designed cycling apparel while donating to meaningful nonprofit causes.

Risks & Challenges
As with any startup, there are associated risks and challenges with our progress. Our goal from the beginning has be to eliminate and minimize the risks and challenges our team will face, and we have with great success. Manufacturing logistics, gender differences in our apparel lines, ease of website use, and nonprofit partnerships all came with associated hurdles (or barricades, you cyclocross junkies) our founder overcame.  At K.O.M. Apparel, we believe one of our biggest challenges to be brand outreach and user engagement. Putting our name onto the radar of riders is of the utmost importance, and it is what will allow our entire crowdsourcing and donation platform to thrive. Luckily, in talking with incredible mentors available at the University of Wisconsin - Whitewater, and such successful crowdsourcing business founders as Henry Schwartz at MobCraft Beer, our team is confident in our ability to meet these challenges. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We mentioned a potential challenge of user engagement, and that's where you come in. Whether you can or are willing to donate, sharing our campaign and brand is something everyone can take part in. If you believe in our movement, take a moment to share, tweet, forward, link... anything our campaign. At the top of this campaign page, Indiegogo features simple to use sharing tools.
Thank you, and we at K.O.M. Apparel are eager to begin our progress together.

story:
About Lunar Gala

On its 100th anniversary, the Chinese Students Club of Columbia University will be launching its 38th annual Lunar Gala Culture and Fashion Show, the largest student production on campus showcasing the very best of Columbia students' creative visions, interdisciplinary talents, and diverse cultural perspectives.

In organizing this year's show under the theme of Harmony, we need your help in putting everything together to symbolize nature’s beautiful lines, sights, and sounds coming together in beautiful harmony the same way our creatives of all fields unite their talents to bring together this one-of-a-kind show!

What We Need & What You Get

By donating to LGFS, you are supporting a passionate group of student directors, producers, models, photographers, and artists dedicated to promoting cultural diversity and bringing the forefront of the fashion industry to campus.

All final funds from the campaign will be used for resources crucial to the show’s artistic success such as:

  • Equipment rental & technical fees, including lighting, sound, and staging ($700)
  • Marketing and publicity materials ($100)
  • Materials for student designs ($200)
  • Purchase of set design pieces, clothing, accessories, and cosmetics ($200)

The Impact

All proceeds from the show will go to Heart to Heart Community Care in Yunnan Province, China. The organization seeks to help migrant workers and their families. By contributing to our project, you will not only help us entertain the Columbia community while empowering our models and celebrating multiculturalism but also help change the lives of a community in need!

To learn more about LGFS, check out our photo gallery or visit us on our Facebook page. Email any questions to our directors at lunargalafashion@gmail.com. 

If you are unable to contribute here, we invite you to reach out in any other way, or even just to say hi! We would love your help in getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign!

story:
This Crowdfunding Campaign Was 100 Years and 4 Generations in the Making, By Simon Martin

Luno Wear Watches (aka my newest obsession), By Rebecca 

A GRANDFATHER AND GRANDSON TEAM UP TO MAKE INNOVATIVE (AND STYLISH) WOODEN WATCHES, By DANNY HUIZINGA

  Heavie Dutie Style

LunoWear help watch lovers see the wood from the trees – Watch Out Wednesday, By Neil Horne

Watch out for LunoWear, by Joe Baron

LunoWear Launches Online Crowd Funding Campaign for its All Natural Wooden Watches, By Geethu Lawrence


Returned Mormon missionary continues family legacy of watchmaking, By Morgan Jones


 - BAMBOO and EBONY WOOD: Each watch features an all natural bamboo or ebony wood case that is rich in texture. No watch is exactly the same.

- GENUINE LEATHER: Each watch features a high quality, genuine leather band.

- STYLISH yet UNIQUE: Our watches were designed to fit right in with the latest fashion trends and styles, while at the same time, stand out from all the other watches out there. It's a beautiful paradox.

- COMFORTABLE: Wood and leather are extremely light weight. Each watch weighs less than one ounce and the leather band form fits to your wrist for a customized fit. 

- DURABLE: Neither wood nor leather wears the other down. They work together in perfect harmony to create a lightweight, yet durable time piece. 

- ON TIME: With the help of an experienced watchmaker, we selected a high quality and accurate Japanese quartz movement to ensure that you and your watch are always on time. 

-WE NEED YOUR HELP: We've lined up a manufacture and have had samples made. In order to enter production we need to order the watches in huge quantities. This means we need lots of money to make the first order... which two full time students don't have. By pre-ordering a watch today, you can help us raise the money we need to purchase the raw materials and enter into production.

-ELITE LUNOWEAR MEMBER: Anyone who backs us by pledging $45 or more will receive this Elite Status. With this status you will receive 20% off lunowear products for life (any product purchased from our website).



Our men's watches are slightly bigger then our women's watches, which is really the only thing that makes them "men's watches" or "women's watches". Many women choose to wear a men's watch and visa versa. You do you!


Nearly a century ago, my great-grandfather lost his leg in a saw mill accident. Devastated by the loss of his leg and terrified about how he would provide for his family, he thought all was lost. At the time, watchmaking was a rare, but highly needed skill. With the need for local watchmakers, the state of Utah paid to have my great-grandfather trained and certified to work on a variety of time pieces. With his newly acquired skill his family not only got by, they thrived. He became a very successful and well known watchmaker. His son (my grandfather) took over the family business when his father retired. That experience with my great grandfather instilled in my family an undying passion and gratitude for the trade of watchmaking. 

(My grandfather, Calvin)                                            (My great-grandfather, Wilfred)

Growing up I spent hours in awe watching my grandfather work on watches in his shop. Every year for my birthday, I would flip through my grandfathers catalogs and pick out a watch, which my grandparents would then get me as a gift. I've acquired quite the collection over the years. Before this project began, I was looking at my watch collection and thought "whats next?" I wanted something different than anything I had. After some time searching, I decided I needed to add a wooden watch to the collection. After months of looking, I couldn't find the wood watch I had in mind, so I approached my grandfather with my situation and we decided to create it with some help from a good friend of mine. 

Watches were something I had developed a passion for, but I knew very little about watch design. I had a good idea as to what I wanted the outcome to be like (look, price etc) but that was strictly cosmetic. I knew very little about watch movements, crystals, bands, cases etc. Calvin (my grandfather) was instrumental in the design process. He helped us design an incredibly reliable and affordable time piece. Without Calvin, there would only be an idea and sketches of what could be. His true passion lies in old pocket watches with a jeweled mechanical movement, but he loves any unique time piece. He was thrilled to get involved with the project.

Any great product starts with an idea and slowly evolves into a finished product. LunoWear Watches were no different. 

-The Idea-

The idea started not as a business venture, but as a result of looking for a wooden watch for personal use. We found several options, but none that met our high expectations. A year and a half ago we noticed the need for a better looking and more affordable wood watch. We hit the drawing board.

-The Paper-

After doing a lot of research with current products, we had a pretty good idea of what we wanted the watch to have. We put together a rough sketch of the idea and labeled the main parts. We knew we wanted the finished product to have a wood case and leather band. We came up with a checklist of things we wanted the finished watch to accomplish. We wanted to make sure the watch was affordable yet maintain a high standard of quality. The design had to be aesthetically pleasing. Of course, the watch had to keep accurate time. We wanted the watch to be slim and simplistic. We had a pretty good idea as to what we wanted the final product to look like, but that was strictly cosmetic. We knew very little about what went into making a quality watch. We knew we would need a professionals help so I immediately went to my grandfather to seek his advice. Once we had a few rough sketches and the main details on paper and the processional help we needed, it was time to find a manufacturer who could turn this idea and sketch into a reality.

-The Manufacturer-

We spent weeks researching different manufacturers. We came up with a list of manufacturers that would be able to create what we had in mind. After an extensive process of sifting though manufacturers, we finally selected one. We then sought out companies who had experience working with them and found nothing but positive feedback. We are proud to say that all the research paid off and we have found a very reliable manufacturer that produces high quality products. With a manufacturer lined up, the detailed design was next. 

-The Design-

Our manufacturer presented their capabilities to us. They showed us the extensive options they had to offer for the customization of the watches. We literally had hundreds of options at our fingertips. We were very excited to get going on our designs, to say the least! For each watch we selected the case, case-back, case size, wood type, band material and band size, buckle type, movement, glass type, bezel, stitching and stitching color, crown, etc. No detail was left untouched. Throughout the whole process we worked hand in hand with Calvin, my grandfather. This was a thrill for us all. For us, we were designing or first watches. For Calvin, he was designing most likely his last watch ever. Our manufacturer had several different movement, crystal, and watch dimension options to choose from. I had no idea what the differences were between them. We all agreed that the goal was to create a reliable and durable, yet affordable time piece. My grandfather was the brain behind making that happen. He helped us select the Miyota 2035 Japanese Quartz Movement to use for each of our watches. With our manufacturer, we started with a conceptual graphic design for each watch. We spent weeks changing and fine tuning the graphics until we were satisfied. We then gave our manufacture the "thumbs-up" to create the first round of samples. Once the first samples were done we fine tuned them some more, making some minor changes. After months in the design process, we took a step back and couldn't help but smile. They looked GREAT!

-The Test-

Once we got our samples Calvin was the best partner you could ever have. He took the watches apart to verify the quality of each component. After 50+ years as a watchmaker, he has incredibly high expectations for a timepiece. They got his approval on every level. Once they passed the integrity check, it was time to really put them to the test. We spent a year testing our watches to ensure they could keep up with our active lifestyle. It has been over a year now and each of our watches have met our every expectation. When we got our watches, we were excited to make them available to the world but we didn't feel right selling them until we gave them a thorough test. We can say with complete confidence, we are offering a quality product. We stand by our watches 100%.

-Why Our Watches-

With the wide variety of watches available in the world (both wood and steel) the question arises, "why should I buy this one when there are similar looking watches out there". Our answer is simple, Ours are different. As mentioned above, we spent months focusing on the small and seemingly insignificant details. It is the small things that all come together to create a masterpiece. We feel that is the case with our watch designs, we hope you agree! With the help from a reputable life-long watchmaker, we used affordable and high quality components for our watches. They are built to last without breaking the bank. We have throughly tested and inspected our watches. We stand by them 100%. We hope people are just as thrilled with our customer service as they are with our watches. We are offering a 1 year warranty for any manufacturer defects. We will work with you on a case by case basis to repair or replace your watches, should any issue arise. We also have big plans for the future of our brand. We are looking forward to a bright future of innovative and quality products. We know we couldn't make this happen without our backers. To show our appreciation, we are offering anyone who supports our project by buying a watch, 20% off LunoWear products...FOR LIFE!


Meet Boman Farrer (left) and Ryan Krantz (right). We are LunoWear. We grew up on the east side of Salt Lake City, UT with the mountains literally in our backyard. Salt Lake is a very active and fashionable city. We set out to create a brand that could link the two lifestyles together. 

We've created a time piece that fits right in with minimalist type fashion accessories, while still being unique and different. Our watches feature a sleek and simple all natural bamboo or ebony wood case with a genuine leather band. This construction accomplished several things:

-Fashionable-

Wood is in. It's different and unique, yet stylish. 

-Comfortable-

With the combination of wood and leather, each watch weighs less than one ounce. The genuine leather band forms to your wrist for a customized fit. 

-Durable-

Leather wears well over time. Ebony wood is extremely dense and bamboo is incredibly flexible which creates a durable case that will be long lasting. Wood and leather complement each other nicely and neither one wears the other down.

*Each wood case has a water resistant/protective finish so moisture from splashing during hand washing or rain isn't an issue, but they are not submersible.  We strongly recommend avoiding any contact with water.

-Unique-

A wooden watch isn't something you see every day. In and of itself it's unique but each wood case has a slightly different pattern, thus every watch is different from the next.

-Represent-

We chose to use bamboo and ebony wood for our watch cases. 

Ebony wood is very dense. In fact, it's so dense it sinks in water. With wood, dense = durable, so we knew we could count on it to last.

Bamboo is also very durable. It is extremely flexible which means the wood will "micro-flex" rather then crack or break if dropped or bumped.

Both woods offer a unique textured look that stands out. 

Once we got our first samples of watches, we couldn't wait to put them through the ringer to see if they would pass the lifestyle test. We threw everything we could think of at them... and they passed with flying colors.

We used the watches doing all the activities we do on regular basis to make sure they wouldn't hold us back. We used them biking (and crashing), rock climbing, fly fishing, hiking, golfing, playing tennis and of course, work and school. 
We have spent a lot of time developing these products. We have worked with many manufacturers to find the best one. We found them and have worked out the ideal timetable for the man hours needed to fulfill all the pledges we receive. We are confident in our team's ability to succeed in fulfilling all orders by the time we have specified. We do understand that with any project there can be issues and roadblocks that arise. We believe in transparency and should any problem arise we will quickly reach out to all backers to explain the situation. We will then stop at nothing to get your rewards to you. We don't believe in the 8-5 work day and we will work all hours of the day to fix the situation. Thank you so much for your support!
Update and info on our switch from Kickstarter to Indiegogo:

As the days have passed we have gathered more information.

Some background info:
How watch manufacturing works, and now it has worked for the last 30+ years, is when one wants to design a watch, they reach out to a watch manufacture. From there, they design a watch with readily available components (e.g. movement, case, case dimensions, case material, crystal type, band material, band dimensions, hands, face, numbers, dial, bezel etc) and finish it off with their brand logo. This is how the vast majority of watch companies manufacture watches, with the exception of brands like Rolex. They manufacture their own watches, which is in part why they are so expensive. Keep in mind, we are selling ours for $45.

Anyways, this is what we did with my grandfather on board helping us pick quality and reliable components. Unfortunately, when designing a watch with readily available components, anyone (including your manufacturer) can design the same or similar watch. Unfortunately many people, including Kickstarter, didn't take the time to do their homework and claimed we were "scamming" people by buying wholesale watches and reselling them for a profit. NOT THE CASE! We have all the files and information we need to prove otherwise. You'll also notice that you can't find anything similar to many of our other watches.

Case in point:

http://www.alibaba.com/…/High-Quality-stainless-steel-watch…

http://www.nixon.com/us/en/product/48-20-chrono-A486.html…

It is the "same watch" with minor differences. Does this mean Nixon didn't design their watches? No, it means they used readily available components that anyone has access to which inevitably leads to being able to find similar looking watches on the internet.

You can do this same process with ANY watch on kickstarter. If you take a few minutes to look for their watch on the internet, especially Alibaba, you will find their watch. The wood and leather watch industry is much smaller so you will find similar watches easier, but if you look closely for similar steel watches, you'll find them no problem.

This is what the critics of our campaign and Kickstarter failed to understand. All Kickstarter would have had to do is ask and we could have sent them over all our design files and conversations with our manufacture that took place well over a year ago. This is what Indiegogo did and we resolved the issue.

I hope this can clear up some of the misconceptions going around.

Thank you so much for all of the support!


Get Your Project Funded Today!

Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!
story_txt:

For each watch we selected the case, case-back, case size, wood type, band material and band size, buckle type, movement, glass type, bezel, stitching and stitching color, crown, etc. No detail was left untouched. Throughout the whole process we worked hand in hand with Calvin, my grandfather. This was a thrill for us all. For us, we were designing or first watches. For Calvin, he was designing most likely his last watch ever. Our manufacturer had several different
movement, crystal, and watch dimension options to choose from. I had no idea
what the differences were between them. We all agreed that the goal was to create a
reliable and durable, yet affordable time piece. My grandfather was the brain behind making
that happen. He helped us select the Miyota 2035 Japanese Quartz Movement to use for each of our watches. With our manufacturer, we started with a conceptual graphic design for each watch. We spent weeks changing and fine tuning the graphics until we were satisfied. We then gave our manufacture the "thumbs-up" to create the first round of samples. Once the first samples were done we fine tuned them some more, making some minor changes. After months in the design process, we took a step back and couldn't help but smile. They looked GREAT!
-The Test-
Once we got our samples Calvin was the best partner you could ever have. He took the watches apart to verify the quality of each component. After 50+ years as a watchmaker, he has incredibly high expectations for a timepiece. They got his approval on every level. Once they passed the integrity check, it was time to really put them to the test. We spent a year testing our watches to ensure they could keep up with our active lifestyle. It has been over a year now and each of our watches have met our every expectation. When we got our watches, we were excited to make them available to the world but we didn't feel right selling them until we gave them a thorough test. We can say with complete confidence, we are offering a quality product. We stand by our watches 100%.
-Why Our Watches-
With the wide variety of watches available in the world (both wood and steel) the question arises, "why should I buy this one when there are similar looking watches out there". Our answer is simple, Ours are different. As mentioned above, we spent months focusing on the small and seemingly insignificant details. It is the small things that all come together to create a masterpiece. We feel that is the case with our watch designs, we hope you agree! With the help from a reputable life-long watchmaker, we used affordable and high quality components for our watches. They are built to last without breaking the bank. We have throughly tested and inspected our watches. We stand by them 100%. We hope people are just as thrilled with our customer service as they are with our watches. We are offering a 1 year warranty for any manufacturer defects. We will work with you on a case by case basis to repair or replace your watches, should any issue arise. We also have big plans for the future of our brand. We are looking forward to a bright future of innovative and quality products. We know we couldn't make this happen without our backers. To show our appreciation, we are offering anyone who supports our project by buying a watch, 20% off LunoWear products...FOR LIFE!

Meet Boman Farrer (left) and Ryan Krantz (right). We are LunoWear. We grew up on the east side of Salt Lake City, UT with the mountains literally in our backyard. Salt Lake is a very active and fashionable city. We set out to create a brand that could link the two lifestyles together. 




We've created a time piece that fits right in with minimalist type fashion accessories, while still being unique and different. Our watches feature a sleek and simple all natural bamboo or ebony wood case with a genuine leather band. This construction accomplished several things:
-Fashionable-

Wood is in. It's different and unique, yet stylish. 
-Comfortable-

With the combination of wood and leather, each watch weighs less than one ounce. The genuine leather band forms to your wrist for a customized fit. 
-Durable-

Leather wears well over time. Ebony wood is extremely dense and bamboo is incredibly flexible which creates a durable case that will be long lasting. Wood and leather complement each other nicely and neither one wears the other down.
*Each wood case has a water resistant/protective finish so moisture from splashing during hand washing or rain isn't an issue, but they are not submersible.  We strongly recommend avoiding any contact with water.
-Unique-

A wooden watch isn't something you see every day. In and of itself it's unique but each wood case has a slightly different pattern, thus every watch is different from the next.
-Represent-

We chose to use bamboo and ebony wood for our watch cases. Ebony wood is very dense. In fact, it's so dense it sinks in water. With wood, dense = durable, so we knew we could count on it to last.


Bamboo is also very durable. It is extremely flexible which means the wood will "micro-flex" rather then crack or break if dropped or bumped.

Both woods offer a unique textured look that stands out. 

Once we got our first samples of watches, we couldn't wait to put them through the ringer to see if they would pass the lifestyle test. We threw everything we could think of at them... and they passed with flying colors.
We used the watches doing all the activities we do on regular basis to make sure they wouldn't hold us back. We used them biking (and crashing), rock climbing, fly fishing, hiking, golfing, playing tennis and of course, work and school. 

We have spent a lot of time developing these products. We have worked with many manufacturers to find the best one. We found them and have worked out the ideal timetable for the man hours needed to fulfill all the pledges we receive. We are confident in our team's ability to succeed in fulfilling all orders by the time we have specified. We do understand that with any project there can be issues and roadblocks that arise. We believe in transparency and should any problem arise we will quickly reach out to all backers to explain the situation. We will then stop at nothing to get your rewards to you. We don't believe in the 8-5 work day and we will work all hours of the day to fix the situation. Thank you so much for your support!

Update and info on our switch from Kickstarter to Indiegogo:

As the days have passed we have gathered more information.
Some background info:How watch manufacturing works, and now it has worked for the last 30+ years, is when one wants to design a watch, they reach out to a watch manufacture. From there, they design a watch with readily available components (e.g. movement, case, case dimensions, case material, crystal type, band material, band dimensions, hands, face, numbers, dial, bezel etc) and finish it off with their brand logo. This is how the vast majority of watch companies manufacture watches, with the exception of brands like Rolex. They manufacture their own watches, which is in part why they are so expensive. Keep in mind, we are selling ours for $45.
Anyways, this is what we did with my grandfather on board helping us pick quality and reliable components. Unfortunately, when designing a watch with readily available components, anyone (including your manufacturer) can design the same or similar watch. Unfortunately many people, including Kickstarter, didn't take the time to do their homework and claimed we were "scamming" people by buying wholesale watches and reselling them for a profit. NOT THE CASE! We have all the files and information we need to prove otherwise. You'll also notice that you can't find anything similar to many of our other watches.
Case in point:
http://www.alibaba.com/…/High-Quality-stainless-steel-watch…
http://www.nixon.com/us/en/product/48-20-chrono-A486.html…
It is the "same watch" with minor differences. Does this mean Nixon didn't design their watches? No, it means they used readily available components that anyone has access to which inevitably leads to being able to find similar looking watches on the internet.
You can do this same process with ANY watch on kickstarter. If you take a few minutes to look for their watch on the internet, especially Alibaba, you will find their watch. The wood and leather watch industry is much smaller so you will find similar watches easier, but if you look closely for similar steel watches, you'll find them no problem.
This is what the critics of our campaign and Kickstarter failed to understand. All Kickstarter would have had to do is ask and we could have sent them over all our design files and conversations with our manufacture that took place well over a year ago. This is what Indiegogo did and we resolved the issue.
I hope this can clear up some of the misconceptions going around.
Thank you so much for all of the support!




Get Your Project Funded Today!





Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!

story:
Short Summary

Berry Fashionista is an online platform dedicated to bringing fashion enthusiasts a variety of items from multiple styles. Our goal is to offer these fashionable delights at very affordable prices. 

Our team is a group of dedicated fashion enthusiasts that are always seeking incredible prices for our customers to enjoy. We are passionate about simplicity and this is why our website represents simplicity of use and design.

Our mission is to create a community of fashion lovers and always be able to offer them unique value through great prices, new trends, and great service.

What We Need & What You Get

We need capital to be able to maximize inventory, improve packaging design, and be able to expand to other markets.

With your donation and an email with shipping information we will ship you this necklace as a symbol of our appreciation for your support.

You can find out more about us or see or products at www.berryfashionista.com

story:
80% of infections spread through hands!

KOURA is an antibacterial Touch Guard for your fingers against germs. Its innovative design and infused pine tree resin protect you and others around you. KOURA is durable and reusable - a sustainable choice for staying safe.

We launched this Indiegogo campaign to enable us to set up production and launch KOURA to the world. By supporting us you show you care for yourself, others around you and the environment.​

 

 

KOURA is sort of a “glove” that you wear in three fingers. It is easy to use and carry with you wherever you go (www.koura.eu). KOURA is the world’s first product made from new innovative Finnish material called PREXELENT™. It is infused with pine tree resin which according to a study*, kills 99,96% of harmful microbes within couple of hours (www.prexelent.com). KOURA is a long-lasting product that reduces the use of plastic disposable gloves and alternative antimicrobial materials that are made from harmful metals like zinc, silver or copper. KOURA is easy to wash and disinfect so that you can use it over and over again. It is 100% made in Finland.

 

We are Pari Vesaa ja Masa, a design company from Finland. The name means Two Vesas and Masa, referring to the founders of the company. The journey began 2017 with our first innovation, a potato scrubber called Potturi (www.potturi.fi). It soon became popular in Finland and enabled the company to continue designing practical, useful and innovative everyday design products. 

 

The idea of KOURA started in April 2020 in the middle of Covid-19 pandemic. People were afraid of this new threat and did not want to move around or meet others. We wanted to help people feel safer and do our part to make the world a little bit better place for all of us. We worked days and nights besides our day jobs to make Koura happen. Two months later the product sample was ready. The journey has just began, please help us to continue it.

 

We are looking for backers to enable us to launch KOURA. Currently we are in prototype phase and the funding will help us buy production molds, set up production and launch Koura. We take all the support we can get, but ideally are looking for 50.000 euros to do this. In return we give our backers generous discounts for pre-ordering Koura. Up to -50% depending on the amount you order. By supporting us you show you care for yourself, others around you and the environment.

If you are not able to contribute, help us by sharing KOURA message in social media!

 

See how KOURA works:

 

KOURA - SHOW YOU CARE

www.koura.eu

 

KOURA size chart:

 

 

 

*Study conducted by Technical Research Centre of Finland 2020
