story:
Phil·o·me·la

In Greek mythology, Philomela was a woman who was sexually assaulted by her sister’s husband, who then cut her tongue out to keep her from talking. So she wove a tapestry that depicted the story of what had happened to her, and presented it to the gods in a request for justice. The gods granted her request, and turned Philomela and her sister into a nightingale and a starling, so that they could fly away and be free. Philomela will be the name of our new line, because it embodies the story of our artisans, who had their voices taken away but now are given a chance to fly free.

You read that right—we're starting a new line! After looking closely at market trends and profit models, we realized that in order for Imagine Goods to thrive, we need to tap into the ethical goods market with more upscale goods. Don't worry—the items you know and love won't go anywhere. We're going to continue making the popular Imagine Goods items, and we're going to continue offering them to you at affordable prices. But in addition to those, our new line will be targeting a different demographic—one that brings a higher profit margin so that we can grow Imagine Goods and employ more survivors.

The Phil·o·me·la line will be:

  • Simple, classic, luxury dresses, blouses, and skirts
  • Fair-trade certified
  • B Corp certified
  • Fabrics that are hand-woven using all-natural dyes 

And, of course, all handmade by EMPOWERED SURVIVORS OF TRAFFICKING, like all Imagine Goods products!

What We Need 

In order to get started, we need just $10,000 for:

  • A pattern cutter to create unique, beautiful pieces 
  • Excellent photography to showcase Phil·o·me·la to a luxury market
  • Website, promotional materials, & branding

The Impact

If we can raise just $10,000 to start Phil·o·me·la, we can provide, in the FIRST year, the following for 5 artisans!

  • A thriving wage
  • On-site child care
  • Mental & physical health care
  • Continuing education
  • Family-style lunch

Why We Do What We Do

We've been traveling to Cambodia for 11 years now, working with several organizations that provide services to survivors of trafficking. And we've heard one thing over and over again. In order for true, lasting societal change, SURVIVORS NEED JOBS. When an artisan receives empowering work in the employment center, whole extended families' lives are changed: now, instead of begging or living in a brothel with mom, a child can be in a safe, on-site child care, next to an empowered and employed mom. 

TOGETHER, LET'S EMPOWER MORE.

 

This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities. Social enterprises focus on a triple bottom line:  people, planet, and profit. Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2017, winners received over $50,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes. In addition, all participants have agreed to donate 5% of their total raised funds from their crowdfunding campaign to ASSETS.

 

Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information.

 

To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here: https://www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterp....

story:
Hello, I'm Kaitlyn Machos and I am a senior at Savannah College of Art and design pursuing my degree in fashion. Part of my the requirements to graduate from SCAD  is a completion of a senior project.  As a Fashion Design major our senior project is to design a collection of six outfits.  Not only are we to come up with a themed concept, but actually realize it.  This includes raising money for the raw materials to produce my six garments, raw materials for the person I am collaborating for the accessories, and buying shoes for the models to wear for the Senior Fashion Show that is held for the public.

 

Exposed is a collection that was initially inspired by shattered glass and the way it cracks. This past year during winter finals my car was broken into and they completely shattered the glass of my car. Not only did the glass break into several beautiful shapes, colors, and reflections; but also it gave me a life realization. As I worked on the collection and talked with others, the meaning developed into something more personal. This project was going to be a way to express my emotions about all the bad things and the people I have lost involving shattered glass.

 

Before, I just found beauty in the shattered glass in the colors and shapes, but I found the beauty in the story that these cracks would tell. Ever since I was little everything bad that has happened in my life has involved shattered glass and the deaths of 20 of my closest friends in car accidents since my sophomore year of high school. Since I didn't expect any of these moments to happen, they did ... thus my inspiration found me. But the collection is not meant to be dark, it meant to take those lost moments and make them beautiful. It is meant to celebrate the life of the ones who I have lost and to possibly have emotional closure.

 

While thinking about all of these factors, I finally realized I was trying to expose myself. Trying to expose my vulnerability; to shed the armor of emotions I have been hiding behind for years; to final reveal the emotional secrets that I have kept hidden for so long. Thus my journey for self-revelation and healing began.

 

My ideal goal is to raise $8000.00 to $10,000 to properly produce my vision.  Upon Completion of my senior requirements I would like to showcase my work to show others how art can be part of a healing process.  I have already starting reaching out to the public about this idea, I would also like to take my collection to high schools to encourage students to follow their dreams and how they can turn tragedy into a positive energy.  Let them know if they put their mind to it they can accomplish whatever they want.

Any contribution means a lot, but helping me spread the word about my collection would be greatly appreciated!

 

SPECIAL THANKS TO EVERYONE WHO HAS HELPED ME THUS FAR ESPECIALLY 
KELSEY, PEDRO, AND RICARDO.

story:
El Sótano Sellado 4 te necesita para lanzar su nueva camiseta "El Gran Teatro Ovni 3".

Ayúdanos con tu contribución a fabricar y distribuir la nueva camiseta temática del SS4, "El Gran Teatro Ovni 3", que será comercializada en varias tallas disponibles. El diseño de la foto es DEFINITIVO. El diseño final irá a cargo del dibujante de cómics Pablo Ríos, autor de "Azul y Pálido" entre otros.

Consíguela antes que nadie y échanos una mano con tu contribución. El Gran Teatro Ovni y el SS4 lo merecen. ¡Compártelo entre tus amistades y oyentes!

 

 

 

 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

Presenta más detalles:

 
  •  
  • explica cuánto financiamiento necesitas y a dónde va. Sé transparente y específico, la gente necesita confiar en ti para que quiera financiarte.
  •  
  • Cuéntale a la gente sobre tus recompensas exclusivas. ¡Haz que se entusiasmen!
  •  
  • Describe a dónde van los fondos si no logras la meta total.
  •  
 

 

 

El impacto

 

Explica tu campaña en mayor detalle y cuéntale a la gente la diferencia que hará su contribución:

 
  •  
  • explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.
  •  
  • Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).
  •  
  • Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.
  •  
 

 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Las personas valoran la transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al ofrecer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta.

 
  •  
  • Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos.
  •  
  • Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.
  •  
 

 

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

 
  •  
  • pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
  •  
  • Recuérdales que usen las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
  •  
 

 

Y eso es todo.

explica por qué tu proyecto es valioso para el colaborador y para el mundo.
 
Describe tu historial de éxito en proyectos como este (si lo tienes).
 
Haz que la gente lo sienta real y genera confianza.
 
   Riesgos y desafíos Las personas valoran la transparencia. Sé abierto y destácate al ofrecer perspectivas sobre los riesgos y obstáculos que puedes enfrentar en el camino hacia lograr tu meta. 
 
Comparte lo que hace que te destaques para superar estos obstáculos.
 
Describe tu plan para solucionar estos desafíos.
 
   Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar: 
 
pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
 
Recuérdales que usen las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
 
  Y eso es todo.

story:
Join us in Paradiso...

Paradiso is a Two Day EGL event in the heart of the United States, where any Japanese Fashion enthusiast is welcome to come and experience the divinity of fashion! The event is scheduled for June 2016 in Kansas City, Missouri.

The Paradiso staff was formed by members of the Kansas City, Columbia, and St. Louis communities in order to bring together the Japanese Fashion enthusiasts in the state of Missouri. We held our first "mega-meet" in June of 2014, and though it was a small event, all agreed that it was a delightful experience and that we should continue the tradition the following year.  

We believe that the EGL community in the United States should be a safe place for all of its members, and that there should be more events by Lolitas, for Lolitas (and oujis and mori girls too, of course!) We aspire to be a catalyst in the movement to bring the communities of the Midwest closer together so that we may all share our love of Japanese Street Fashion with one another in a caring, supportive environment.

By contributing to our campaign, you'll help us lay the foundation for what is sure to be an enchanting event, with guest speakers, vendors, a fashion show and tea. Additionally, by banding together to crowd fund our campaign, you'll prove that EGL enthusiasts are passionate enough to host their own, independent events outside of the umbrella of anime and media conventions that have over shadowed our interests in the past.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to secure our venue space and ensure our guests and vendors have all of the accommodations necessary for a spectacular event, we need your help!  We will be hosting the event in the heart of the United States, in Kansas City, Missouri at the historic Loose Mansion. For Paradiso to blossom into the convention that the team has envisioned, we are seeking $5500 for the deposit on our venue, and to invest in the expansion of the event in the following year. To say thank you to all of our spectacular donors, we have a number of exclusive perks for our supporters, including exclusive artwork by Animator and Illustrator, Teal Sather, and Printmaker and Paradiso Director, Shelly Forbis.


$5.00 USD - Thank you for your contribution! You'll receive a special letter from the Paradiso Staff and we will list you on our donor page on our website.

$10.00 USD - Contributors will receive 1 limited edition postcard print by Teal Sather and be listed on our donor page.

$25.00 USD - Contributors will receive a set of 5 limited edition postcard prints by Teal Sather and be listed on our donor page.

$35.00 USD - Contributors will receive 10% off their event tickets, 5 limited edition postcards by Teal Sather, and be listed on our donor page.

$50.00 USD - Contributors will receive a limited edition tote bag and set of 5 postcards, each with art by Teal Sather, 10% off their event tickets, and will be listed on our donor page.

$75.00 USD - Contributors will receive a limited edition tote bag and set of 5 postcards, each with art by Teal Sather, a limited edition Paradiso poster print by Shelly Forbis, 10% off their event tickets, access to EARLY event registration and will be listed on our donor page.

$100.00 USD - Contributors will receive a handmade sash, limited edition tote bag and set of 5 postcards, each with art by Teal Sather, a limited edition Paradiso poster print by Shelly Forbis, 15% off their event tickets, access to EARLY event registration and will be listed on our donor wall at the event as well as on our website.

$150.00 USD - Contributors will have their choice of either a handmade sash OR a handmade rectangle head dress,  limited edition tote bag and set of 5 postcards, each with art by Teal Sather, a limited edition Paradiso poster print by Shelly Forbis, 15% off their event tickets, access to EARLY event registration and will be listed on our donor wall at the event as well as on our website.

$200.00 USD - Contributors will receive an EXCLUSIVE Japanese Street Fashion Paper Doll Set with artwork by Christen Mazurak-Fike and Teal Sather, their choice of either a handmade sash OR a handmade rectangle head dress, limited edition tote bag and set of 5 postcards, each with art by Teal Sather, a limited edition Paradiso poster print by Shelly Forbis, 15% off their event tickets, access to EARLY event registration and will be listed on our donor wall at the event as well as on our website. Last, but not least, up to two tickets purchased to the event by these donors will be upgraded to VIP automatically!


In the event that we are unable to reach our fundraising goals, all of the money that we do raise will be put towards the rental of our venue space and our ticket prices will see an increase. Additionally, we will need to host an additional campaign the following year to keep the event afloat. Help us reach our goal so that Paradiso may blossom into an annual convention!

The Impact

Your contributions will help us prove that Japanese Fashion is a growing passion in the United States and that the community is strong and supportive enough to host its own conventions and events. We will unite the Japanese Fashion communities across the Midwest and foster new opportunities for attendees to share their passions, their stories, and their designs with other like-minded individuals.


Risks & Challenges

We face many challenges as we prepare for our 2016 event. The Paradiso team will be working hard to provide an enchanting atmosphere for all of our attendees, attracting exclusive guests and vendors, and seeing to all the nuances involved in hosting a fashion show. Our staff contains a wide variety of individuals, including seamstresses, fundraisers, social media experts, artists, and seasoned fashion show participants. Together, we'll be able to create a one of a kind event for all of our very special guests using our combined talents!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The Paradiso team understands that not everyone can donate financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us make a difference! Check out and like our Facebook page for all of our updates, and share our information with your friends to get them involved in our cause!

https://www.facebook.com/Paradiso-a-Lolita-Fash...

We look forward to seeing you in Paradiso!

story:
How Fé Clothing Came to Be

My name is Michael Peterson and I am the founder of Fé Clothing Line. I was given this vision from God and am doing all I can to make it happen. Fé itself means Faith in spanish and that words has so much meaning behind it. Without faith life would be miserable because we would believe in nothing. 

YOU supporting this vision will help me bring this realization to the world. Our mission: "To INSPIRE and ENCOURAGE the people of the world through FAITH and fashion." Our Motto: Faith in HIM. Faith in SELF. Faith in US.

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP!!!!

We are trying to raise 2,750.00!! Now that sounds like alot of money but thats what it takes to make things like this happen.

 

We will be using the majority on our product with includes not only buying the tank tops, tee shirts, v necks, sweaters, jackets, pants and accessories but also paying for the printing of the designs on them. Also materials and supplies to alter and really make Fé come to life such as sewing machines, thread, fabric and much more. 

We will also be using the funds to buy our website domain, website design, logo, business cards, posters and marketing plans. We will adverstise on facebook and twitter of course but we want to make sure people know we are out there!!

For our website we do need to of course have picutres of our clothes and people wearing them therefore a photoshoot along with models were added into the budget as well.

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN!!

THE DREAM!!

I am in no way, shape, or form embarrased to say that we are going to start out small but we WILL one day be known across the globe. Making a stand in the fashion industry and being a beacon of light and positivty. Love yourself and know that all things are possible if you believe! Just keep you head up and know that winning is a MUST! And when you feel like you no longer believe in yourself, WE BELIEVE IN YOU!

 

LAST BUT NOT LEAST.... TELL EVERYONE!!!

 The more people that know the goal that we are going for the more support we get. AND DONT FEEL BAD IF FINANCIALLY YOU CANNOT SUPPORT... EVEN PUTTING IT ON YOUR FACEBOOK HELPS!! 


Just know that I LOVE YOU ALL and thanks for even taking the time to look at this. 

 

NOTHING IS IMPOSSIBLE!!!

story:
What Is C&F Gear?  

C&F Gear is basically a brand  which combines style with originality  and affordability. C&F Gear started of as an independent high school project, until we grew tiered of seeing everyone wearing the same thing. We was disappointed with the options I had when searching for cloths. We wanted to make sure the C&F Gear design had a original look yet an affordable price. Overall we wanted this new line of clothing to consist of two important aspects:

  • Originality
  • Style

 Originality:

 What sets us apart?  

What makes C&F Gear different is that our clothing have a simplistic look yet it has a meaning.  C&F Gear also have plans for designing more than just T-shirts and Jackets.Our next project will making a backpack. The C&F Gear backpack is planned to have be very well organized. 

Style:  

Style was the most important component we considered when designing C&F Gear products . We wanted a product which looked good with any outfit. These T-shirts, crew necks, hoodies, and jackets will be a fashion statement at school, work, traveling, ANYWHERE. These are the nine color combinations we have created(White/Gold |Navy/Gold | Black/Gold |Red/White| Black/White |Navy/White | White/Black |Black/Black | |Red/black ). They'll be able to match with any outfit and will have you walking around with confidence and swag. We will be starting with these nine colors, as we receive feedback during the campaign, more color combinations will be made available.

T-Shirts:

 If you would like a T-shirt to go along with your Sweatshirt or you are not interested in a sweatshirt but still want to support our campaign, we also offer a very comfortable T-shirt made from 50% cotton and 50% polyester. A survey will be sent to you at the end of the campaign to choose your T-shirt size and color scheme.

How the money raised will be used:  

Your support will be going towards the first production run of the C&F Gear clothing. We have set a campaign goal of $32,000 in order to meet our manufactures' minimum order requirements, shipping costs, taxes, fees, and any miscellaneous costs. This will be necessary because this company started in a classroom where we created up a design. We raised only $84 from our previous bake sale on Jan. 27. We believe with the help we'll get from everyone here on Indiegogo that we can build the C&F Gear brand name into more than just a high school project.

Who is the team(C&F) and how did it all start? Started by young entrepreneurs, fashion enthusiasts, Chino and Faith decided to draw the line of  trying to choose a  sweatshirt,hoodie,etc which had either style OR had originality. We have been big on the fashion world for a long time now and got fed up paying for overpriced name brand cloths. So now we are doing it ourselves. We started as classmates, became friends, and are now  business partners.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

Million Monkey Clothing has been operating since March of 2010.  We currently only sell our products via our website, Facebook, and at events that we set up at.  Our brand has gotten an incredible amount of positive feedback; however, we always have customers ask about our "STORE".  Since the economy has taken a dive it has been difficult for entrepeneurs to open brick and mortar stores.  Our plan is to renovate a Ford E-350 Step Van that we already own and transform it into a mobile store so we can take our products to our customers.  The marketing strategy with a brick and mortar store is to create a plan to drive traffic into your store, but with a mobile store we go to customers.  We not only want to take our products to our customer, we want to create an experience for them as well.  The money from the campaign will help us renovate the van with a vehicle wrap, new engine (so we can travel the nation without worries), new tires, store fixtures to display our products, sound system, generator, appropriate licensing, and the cost to modify the side of the truck so it opens up and doubles as a stage for performances!  Our goal is to be able to display and unveil the truck at an annual event we participate in called Sneaks Up.  The event is on April 29, 2012 in San Antonio, Texas.


The Impact

Part of our vision is to help individuals chase their dreams and become one out of a million.  With the success that this truck will bring us, we will be fortunate enough to help our sponsored artist on a monetary level so they can reach their dreams.  Million Monkey also plans on being involved in our community and giving back.  With the truck we will be able to park it at events such as Habitat for Humanties and donate a portion of our procedes to that non profit.  Not only will it bring awareness to the non profit, but we can raise money for them as well. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign goal is $30,000!!!  Here is where the money is going(remember this is going to be a mobile store with an experience of a lifetime):  Vehicle graphics wrap-5,000, new tires-1,000, side body modification-5,000, fixtures/shelving-3,000, appropriate licensing-500, music/lighting equipment-3,000, generator-1,500, engine-2,500, misc flooring and diamond plating and racks-6,000.  


So here's what's in it for you:  Donation amounts followed by incentives


$10-Button/Sticker set

$25-Million Monkey logo tee* + Silicon bracelet + Button/Sticker set

$50-Two Million Monkey tees from our current series* + Silicon bracelet + Button/Sticker set

$100-Limited Edition tee* + Custom MMC bamboo bracelet + Button/Sticker Set

$500-Limited Edition tee* + Custom Embroidered hat w/ your name on the side + Custom MMC bamboo bracelet + Button/Sticker set + recognition on our website as donor

$1,000-You will become an affiliate member (you get goods at cost) + Custom MMC Limited Edition Coin + Custom MMC bamboo bracelet + Button/Sticker set + recognition on our website as a donor

$5,000-You will get Platinum status with Million Monkey, which means you get every new tee we make sent to your door automatically for the next 5 years + we will drive the monkey truck to your hometown and throw a party for you and your friends + Custom MMC limited Edition Coin + Custom Embroidered Million Monkey Pit Shirt +  Button/Sticker set + recognition on our website as a PLATINUM Member


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and family!!!  The more people that get involved the faster we hit our goal!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Dara Jendayi. I am a 21 year old senior at Florida Atlantic University in Boca Raton, Fl. I am a full-time student at FAU, a part-time student at the Art Institute of Ft. Lauderdale , and I work as a team member of the amazing tech designer and manufacturer, www.theankit.com, I am a team member of Organo Gold, I give sewing lessons on school day evenings, and I work on my clothing line and brand, Jendayi, daily. I am an Artist. I write both spoken word poetry and ghost write music, so I am back and forth to the studio often as well. I perform at events where I can share my art of spoken word; it is a serious passion of mine. I am a busy individual, but I am extremely passionate and relentless with my work ethic. I do freelance gigs whenever I can fit them into my schedule because I can use every extra dollar and quality networking opportunity I can get. I am also very passionate about children, so I keep them in mind as I develop my brand. I run a charity through Jendayi for Shriner's Hospital for Children. I also make sure Jendayi is always something young people can look up to. I have done children's collections and having four- year-olds walking in my clothing always reminds me that they are always looking and absorbing what we put out. I make it mandatory, before anything else, that my models are role models, from how they project themselves on social media, to how they carry themselves in person, to the goals they set for themselves, because what is within, is seen without. I am on a mission to change the world through all my art--with my words, my actions, my wardrobe, and clothing line as I set new precedents and show young people that positivity can be  popular. I am passionate about leadership and ownership. We must protect the art we create, we must positively impact with our gifts, and we must have ownership of what we create and not let anyone take what we are passionate about and merely turn it into  dollars for themselves .
My campaign's purpose is to gain the funds necessary to get crucial things completed for the brand to begin to run more efficiently. This includes the relaunch of my Web site and raising money for the Jendayi fashion event happening in January 2015 (dates subject to shift to February 2015) in Miami, Florida. This event will debut my first ever male collection, it will showcase other budding designers, and it will highlight many young hard working artists. This show will be a direct benefit to the designers and artists being recognized by allowing them to showcase their work to a large audience,  and will also benefit three charities: Haiti- Delivering protein packs to the citizens of Haiti promoting health and the elimination of malnutrition, The Entrepreneurial Academy- A new curriculum started by Gershom Faulkner of St. Petersburg, Fl. that teaches young individuals the ins and outs of entrepreneurship and gives them resources to start their own businesses and a third one TBD. This campaign is extremely important to me because I began Jendayi at age 16. I have been working on Jendayi throughout school, jobs, and throughout my teenage  years and it has grown tremendously from where it began. I am not only the designer (design & construction) of Jendayi's clothing but I also do all my own photography, hair, makeup, styling, marketing, outreach, finances, charity, and all other business aspects of the brand. Due to my budget and resources, I had to learn how to do every aspect of the brand so I could achieve the quality and image I wanted and do it at a pace that I was satisfied with. After I launched my official site in 2012 I started a blog on the site where I did a weekly feature called #WorkingWednedays. This feature garnered over 1000 views a week. On Working Wednesdays I featured young, hard-working individuals, such as Jerome Fulton a college student who, in spite of both parents being deceased, has averaged a 3.9 GPA and is  working with a fortune  500 company. Working Wednesdays was extremely important because not only did it give these hard-working young people some well deserved recognition but young people from all over the country wanted to share their stories with me. I had college students come up to me and tell me they recently got another job so they could be featured. It was a beautiful movement and the relaunching of the site needs to happen so Working Wednesdays can continue! I just hired my first employee (Sept, 9, 2014), and I am taking full advantage of all her skills. She is a mother of a beautiful 7 year old girl. She is eager to chase her dreams of breaking into the fashion world, and she sees the vision and brand of Jendayi as her way in.   Although I am a broke college student, with the typical college student budget expenses of bills, books, fees, etc... I am willing to spend my very last penny to accomplish my dreams
  • Jendayi is not a typical fashion brand. Jendayi was created as a tool to positively impact society with a specific focus on youth. Art, whether it be music, drawings, poetry, fashion, or photography, always has a huge audience, so imagine what would happen if we projected positivity and core values like self-love, faith in self, and work ethic through our art forms- we could change lives, thus changing the world! With your contributions, you are doing just that! When someone wears the Jendayi logo, it is not just a pretty word. Jendayi means faithful and the business message is Stay True to You, and this is what we need to do as individuals. I know a lot of young girls that personally tell me that they actually want to get into more artistic things instead of going to parties all the time, but they have no one to go to museums with and their friends do not support their desires to switch up their lifestyle, so these girls (and guys have expressed this to me as well) continue with their status quo ways due to lack of support. It is easy to say, drop all your friends and do it on your own and go to these places alone, but that is very hard. Jendayi promotes that strength required to branch out and be your true self. Jendayi shows how no desire, dream, or passion is easily achieved, but with faith, patience, and hard work it can be achieved. With every item purchased, every contribution, every ounce of support, Jendayi grows and we are able to spread these amazing, vivifying, world-changing values with more and more people!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The first $1000 dollars of contributions will be dedicated to the technical side of Jendayi, this includes domain repurchasing, site relaunching (which will include the relaunch of the JendayiBLOG!!!). Any extra money from those designated funds will be for my charity, Shriner's Hospital for Children in Tampa, Fl.  The other sum of contributions goes 100% to the event that will be the debut of the new Jendayi collections as well as the charity benefit for the multiple fundraisers. This will be a huge event. I am in need of more funds than requested here, but I know this will be a good start to get the ball rolling and get the proper venue reserved for the event. More sponsors will be requested even after this campaign, as we want to be able to give a great amount to all the charities, and have the proper decor, hosts, etc. Another awesome aspect to this event will be the out of town guests coming in to enjoy the event. I am working to find a great hotel to sponsor a discounted rate so I will be able to offer the out of town guests a complimentary 2-night stay in Miami, Florida the weekend of the event. These guests will be responsible for their travel so I definitely want to provide a nice stay for them free of charge. Out of town guests will include some young people who will be a part of the entrepreneurial academy, young business owners who will be contributing their services to the event, and many others.
  • Every single contributor will be put in a raffle, we will randomly select a lucky winner who will be able to bring a guest to stay in Miami, Fl. at the hotel (tbd) for the weekend of the event, as well as be VIP guests! 
  • Every $100 contributor will be shipped a Jendayi Signature Shirt as well as some great Jendayi extras like stickers and accessories! 
  • Every $500+ contributor is named a sponsor for the event. You will be allowed product placement at the event.
Every single contributor is appreciated beyond belief! 
If the goal is not reached, the funds will be allocated the exact way they would as if the goal was reached. I have full faith that the goal will be surpassed! 

    The Impact

    This event will impact many young, hardworking, talented individuals working to get their name and talent exposed. This event will help budding, quality, talented, designers showcase their clothing lines in front of a large crowd. 

    Success Track

    • Two years in a row I have been able to break the record for attendance at my fashion shows at Florida Atlantic University. I was able to change the annual talent show, Live at IVAN, into a fashion show my sophomore year. At that event I created the largest, most attended housing program ever. Last year I began a fashion group at FAU and to end the year I put on a huge fashion show. This event was the biggest fashion show ever at FAU, surpassing 300 guests. I assisted with every fashion event at FAU last school year, as my track record spoke, and all other organizations wanted that outcome at their event. 
    • At age 16, I produced my first fashion show in St. Petersburg, Fl., titled STRUT. STRUT had over 30 young models from ages 3 to 26 traveling from as far as Orlando to participate in the show as models. This event was held at Nova 535, in downtown St. Pete. Aveda Hair School sponsored all the hair and make up, courtesy of school owner, Mr. Petrillo. Volunteer photographers came to take images for the event and my immediate family played a big role in providing time to complete this event. Designers from Tampa and St. Pete came to showcase their lines and with the successful completion of the event, I was able to form long-lasting relationships with very important people, such as the owner of Nova 535, Michael Novilla.
    • My event coordinating skills are solid and I have created a good network of individuals that can help with multiple aspects of the event. I have a huge vision for Jendayi, therefore I would never release something, be a part of something, or produce something that is not 100% representative of my brand and all it stands for! Following my last show at FAU, people look at me now as a respected designer and event coordinator. There are lots of people who attended the last show and are looking forward to this one, as well as people who were unable to attend and heard the reviews and are looking forward to this upcoming event! 

    Risks & Challenges

    With Jendayi there is a risk of a lack of appeal to the targeted audience. There is always a risk that me as a young person, could get distracted or overwhelmed and have a breakdown preventing me from producing the event I explained. As any event, there is always a risk of a lack of attendance, 

    I am qualified 100% to eliminate and/or minimize all these risks, and your contributions will help me do so. With proper funding I am able to bring in individuals to work in their respective fields of expertise so I can focus on the clothing and the event coordinating. I will be able to outsource help for certain aspects of the event as well, eliminating the risk of me getting overwhelmed and not producing the high quality event I envision. When it comes to the risk of Jendayi lacking appeal, I have become very big on research. Research partnered with my keen eye and ability to create new appealing trends, has helped eliminate about 90% of that risk. Unparalleled work ethic and excellence are a habit for me. I have overcome many hurdles, and I can't imagine any that could stop me at this point. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

     There have been many times someone was having a fundraiser and I was simply financially unable to contribute. I definitely understand! You can still help by sharing this with 5 people you know! Utilize the indiegogo share tools and like, share, tweet, and retweet when you see this via social media! 

    I thank you so much for your time and consideration! Have an AMAZING day!

story:
As Featured In:




Short Summary

MoAp, is about telling a story and making a difference, as we support many charitable organizations through the sales of our products.


Our Story

This project started during the summer of 2012. I was volunteering at the Special Olympics when I saw a little girl and her dad walking side by side. The little girl was discouraged repeatedly telling her dad that she couldn’t do it. The father looks down and tells the little girl you’ve done this before, you can’t give up now. He continues to encourage her as they walk up the street to the next event she was competing in. No matter what the little girl would say, the father had something positive to say and eventually changed her mind. The little girl once discouraged, was now feeling optimistic. This was just one in many instances that I had the opportunity of experiencing. During my time helping at the Special Olympics, I learned the power of optimism. We ourselves go through ups and downs but those athletes taught me that despite adversity that everything will be okay. They didn’t have to say this but being around them it was understood they lived it.

This experienced happen at a strange part of my life. During this time I was going through some issues of my own. The summer of your freshman year you’re still unsure of many things and you’re just looking for an identity. Through the experiences that I’ve shared I really connected with those athletes of the Special Olympics. I wanted to give back but I just didn’t know how until a friend suggested spreading what I’d learned, which was the power of Optimism. The hardest part was finding a way to do so until that same friend suggested T-shirts. His reason being was that to spread Optimism you have to find a way to make it part of individuals daily lives.

In a world today where optimism is needed most we want to make a difference. We believe you represent yourself in someway by the brands you wear and represent. MoAp is believing in yourself, being you and achieving what you want to achieve through positivity and being optimistic. When you wear our products you know with the good conscience that a portion of sales will fund organizations that empower children.

Since Then..

Everyone has moments in their life that change them; that little girl changed my life. It set me on a path to try and give back. Now I have a wonderful team around me that all strive to change the world and create a high quality product that we can all be proud of.

From our Creative Director and our first designer to our interns we have had great people working on making you look good while we all make a huge impact.

We have worked long nights for the past 8 months and are so proud to have an excellent product, a great partnership, and we are ready to make a difference. All we need is YOU!

Our Concern:

MoAp came out of passion to encourage others by creating a brand that only focused on spreading positive energy or spreading the power of optimism while giving back. That passion allowed me to realize somethings:

Things We Noticed:

 1. When we looked at the retail market we seen a lot of negativity. Many of the shirts and other products in the market had phrases such as “SWAG”, “Dope”, or “Middle-fingers”.

We wanted to change the negative market. We believe you represent yourself in someway by the brands you wear and represent. 


Product Demand:

The demand for our products has risen greatly, but we're still small - too small in fact. Our demand has outstripped our ability to keep up, and our ability to keep our customers supplied with the great products in a timely fashion. After support from individuals such as John Legend, Gabrielle Giffords, Common, and Daymond John (from shark tank and founder of FUBU) our demand has increased significantly.


Now, we need to grow, which is a great thing because that is what we set out to do and also to prove that manufacturing in America is still possible, and not only that, it can create jobs over and over again.


What We Need & What You Get





Why Indiegogo?

Ultimately all of the money here is going to help build momentum for MoAp and will be helping us launch our first complete line of t-shirts! In order to do that we need our first production run and we need to start distributing so you can help spread the word about MoAp.


First, we want to offer a wider variety of designs. We currently are limited to what we can afford to stock through our supplier -- and even though we're selling shirts, we have to immediately turn around and put that money into new inventory of our existing designs. We can't make minimum orders of new designs and still have stock of all men's and women's sizes.

Second, we want to offer our shirts in a variety of fits. Our supplier only prints shirts on a Basic Short-Sleeve cut for Men, and a Basic Slim-fit cut for women. BORING! We want to offer our designs on Fashion Fit shirts and V-Necks, which is impossible through the existing supplier network out there.

Finally, and most importantly, we want to support more organizations. When you wear our products you know with the good conscience that a portion of sales will fund organizations that empower children.




Why Our Shirts Rock?

What Our Shirts Fund? 


Through shirt sales, we fund non-profits providing opportunities to children worldwide. Having worked in business development, we know that each non-profit partner will have unique needs and goals; so we structure shirt sales around meeting those specific needs.

Packaging




Here's how this works: you contribute, and at the end of this campaign, we go into production and then ship you your awesome "perk" (in most cases, a shirt). We also get the funding to our partners to make the above projects happen. So pick one of the perks below and let's do this!

*If you Pledge $25 or more, you will receive this shirt, in addition to everything else above!



_________________________________________________________________________








The Impact

We can't do this without your help.  Our fans and contributors are the ones that will drive this campaign.  The only way we can get this campaign started is with your help and support and we're truly grateful to the many of you who have already pledged your support so far.  


Risks & Challenges


1. Pre-production runs of the the shirts have already been completed. Each has been worn, tested, and machine washed/dried. The supply chain is set up and ready for the manufacturer to make moves once funding is received.

2. Delays and unforeseen obstacles are always possible. The likelihood of anything serious occurring is extremely unlikely. If anything serious happens, you will be the first to know.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

    We would love to hear from you! Check out our website www.shopmoap.com and interact with us on Social Media.
    www.facebook.com/Shopmoap
    @ShopMoAp


    -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --

    FAQs

    What if I have more questions that aren't in the FAQs?

    Email us at shopmoap@gmail.com and we will do our best to answer all of your questions!

    What does MoAp stand for?

    MoAp, pronounced [Mo - App], is short for Motivational Apparel.

    How do I get my products?

    If the campaign is successful (please spread the word!), we will contact you to confirm shipping details, shirt affirmation and style, and size. We will give you sizing details before you make your sizing choice so that it is a great fit.

    When will my shirt ship?

    We are working tirelessly to get you the highest quality product as soon as possible. We will be shipping your package to you in July. We still have to put in the purchase order to our manufacturer after a successful Indiegogo campaign, so please be patient with us. We will make sure to get them to you as soon as possible!

    How much of profits goes to the Special Olympics?

    The bottom line is we're a go for 10%, and are working to increase this number as we transition out of start-up phase and approach economies of scale.  

    Is there a warranty on my shirts?

    We hope that you love your MoAp products as much as we love it. But we want you to be happy.

    If for some reason you are not totally happy with your products, you can return it in unused and new condition within 14 days of the delivery date for a credit, exchange, or refund. We do not credit or refund shipping charges. If you need to return or exchange your products please email us at  shopmoap@gmail.com.

    We know you will cherish your products because each one has a story that is defined by the individual that wears it.

    Don’t forget being nice makes everyone's day much better! We promise we will do our best to make you as happy as can be.

    Where are the shirts manufactured?

    It is our goal to keep the production of our products here in the United States. We believe in keeping the jobs here in the. Though this is a goal of ours we have to take one step at a time.

    We went through a rigorous screening process over the past 8 months to make sure that we were manufacturing our shirts in the safest and most supportive environments possible. We are partnering with a manufacturer in Texas who has design facilities here in the US. By going through this third-party we can assure that the factories that MoAp products are being produced in humane conditions and are certified in every way possible. However, it is our goal to bring this process in house.


    What are the risks?

    Well, we really need this campaign to reach its goal. If it doesn't, then your perks will take longer than expected. So spread the word about our campaign!!



    We want to thank everyone for supporting us in this project! Your support means the world to us!

    Finally, we couldn't have done this without the support of our family. So thank you for believing in us and motivating us to go after our dreams!


    Thank you! We hope you will join us in: Creating A More Positive World!

They didn’t have to say this but being around them it was understood they lived it. This experienced happen at a strange part of my life. During this time I was going through some issues of my own. The summer of your freshman year you’re still unsure of many things and you’re just looking for an identity. Through the experiences that I’ve shared I really connected with those athletes of the Special Olympics. I wanted to give back but I just didn’t know how until a friend suggested spreading what I’d learned, which was the power of Optimism. The hardest part was finding a way to do so until that same friend suggested T-shirts. His reason being was that to spread Optimism you have to find a way to make it part of individuals daily lives. In a world today where optimism is needed most we want to make a difference. We believe you represent yourself in someway by the brands you wear and represent. MoAp is believing in yourself, being you and achieving what you want to achieve through positivity and being optimistic. When you wear our products you know with the good conscience that a portion of sales will fund organizations that empower children.Since Then..Everyone has moments in their life that change them; that little girl changed my life. It set me on a path to try and give back. Now I have a wonderful team around me that all strive to change the world and create a high quality product that we can all be proud of. From our Creative Director and our first designer to our interns we have had great people working on making you look good while we all make a huge impact.We have worked long nights for the past 8 months and are so proud to have an excellent product, a great partnership, and we are ready to make a difference. All we need is YOU!Our Concern:MoAp came out of passion to encourage others by creating a brand that only focused on spreading positive energy or spreading the power of optimism while giving back. That passion allowed me to realize somethings: Things We Noticed:  1. When we looked at the retail market we seen a lot of negativity. Many of the shirts and other products in the market had phrases such as “SWAG”, “Dope”, or “Middle-fingers”.We wanted to change the negative market. We believe you represent yourself in someway by the brands you wear and represent. Product Demand:The demand for our products has risen greatly, but we're still small - too small in fact. Our demand has outstripped our ability to keep up, and our ability to keep our customers supplied with the great products in a timely fashion. After support from individuals such as John Legend, Gabrielle Giffords, Common, and Daymond John (from shark tank and founder of FUBU) our demand has increased significantly.Now, we need to grow, which is a great thing because that is what we set out to do and also to prove that manufacturing in America is still possible, and not only that, it can create jobs over and over again.What We Need & What You Get Why Indiegogo?Ultimately all of the money here is going to help build momentum for MoAp and will be helping us launch our first complete line of t-shirts! In order to do that we need our first production run and we need to start distributing so you can help spread the word about MoAp.First, we want to offer a wider variety of designs. We currently are limited to what we can afford to stock through our supplier -- and even though we're selling shirts, we have to immediately turn around and put that money into new inventory of our existing designs. We can't make minimum orders of new designs and still have stock of all men's and women's sizes. Second, we want to offer our shirts in a variety of fits. Our supplier only prints shirts on a Basic Short-Sleeve cut for Men, and a Basic Slim-fit cut for women. BORING! We want to offer our designs on Fashion Fit shirts and V-Necks, which is impossible through the existing supplier network out there. Finally, and most importantly, we want to support more organizations. When you wear our products you know with the good conscience that a portion of sales will fund organizations that empower children. Why Our Shirts Rock?What Our Shirts Fund? Through shirt sales, we fund non-profits providing opportunities to children worldwide. Having worked in business development, we know that each non-profit partner will have unique needs and goals; so we structure shirt sales around meeting those specific needs.Packaging Here's how this works: you contribute, and at the end of this campaign, we go into production and then ship you your awesome "perk" (in most cases, a shirt). We also get the funding to our partners to make the above projects happen. So pick one of the perks below and let's do this!*If you Pledge $25 or more, you will receive this shirt, in addition to everything else above!_________________________________________________________________________The Impact We can't do this without your help.  Our fans and contributors are the ones that will drive this campaign.  The only way we can get this campaign started is with your help and support and we're truly grateful to the many of you who have already pledged your support so far.    Risks & Challenges1. Pre-production runs of the the shirts have already been completed. Each has been worn, tested, and machine washed/dried. The supply chain is set up and ready for the manufacturer to make moves once funding is received.2. Delays and unforeseen obstacles are always possible. The likelihood of anything serious occurring is extremely unlikely. If anything serious happens, you will be the first to know.  Other Ways You Can Help -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --We would love to hear from you! Check out our website www.shopmoap.com and interact with us on Social Media.www.facebook.com/Shopmoap@ShopMoAp-- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --FAQsWhat if I have more questions that aren't in the FAQs?Email us at shopmoap@gmail.com and we will do our best to answer all of your questions!What does MoAp stand for?MoAp, pronounced [Mo - App], is short for Motivational Apparel.How do I get my products?If the campaign is successful (please spread the word!), we will contact you to confirm shipping details, shirt affirmation and style, and size. We will give you sizing details before you make your sizing choice so that it is a great fit.When will my shirt ship?We are working tirelessly to get you the highest quality product as soon as possible. We will be shipping your package to you in July. We still have to put in the purchase order to our manufacturer after a successful Indiegogo campaign, so please be patient with us. We will make sure to get them to you as soon as possible!How much of profits goes to the Special Olympics?The bottom line is we're a go for 10%, and are working to increase this number as we transition out of start-up phase and approach economies of scale.  Is there a warranty on my shirts? We hope that you love your MoAp products as much as we love it. But we want you to be happy.If for some reason you are not totally happy with your products, you can return it in unused and new condition within 14 days of the delivery date for a credit, exchange, or refund. We do not credit or refund shipping charges. If you need to return or exchange your products please email us at  shopmoap@gmail.com.We know you will cherish your products because each one has a story that is defined by the individual that wears it. Don’t forget being nice makes everyone's day much better! We promise we will do our best to make you as happy as can be. Where are the shirts manufactured?It is our goal to keep the production of our products here in the United States. We believe in keeping the jobs here in the. Though this is a goal of ours we have to take one step at a time.We went through a rigorous screening process over the past 8 months to make sure that we were manufacturing our shirts in the safest and most supportive environments possible. We are partnering with a manufacturer in Texas who has design facilities here in the US. By going through this third-party we can assure that the factories that MoAp products are being produced in humane conditions and are certified in every way possible. However, it is our goal to bring this process in house.What are the risks?Well, we really need this campaign to reach its goal. If it doesn't, then your perks will take longer than expected. So spread the word about our campaign!!We want to thank everyone for supporting us in this project! Your support means the world to us!Finally, we couldn't have done this without the support of our family. So thank you for believing in us and motivating us to go after our dreams!Thank you! We hope you will join us in: Creating A More Positive World!

story:
THE STORY BEHIND THE STRAPS

My name is Jon Yeazel, and I wear a lot of suits. One day, almost a year and a half ago, I was looking for the perfect watch strap as a finishing touch for my outfit. It didn’t exist.

I wanted to keep the watch face, but replace the strap with something other than your standard black or brown leather. I tried NATO straps in different materials and colors, but they didn’t feel right. I tried fabric watchbands with lugs, but they were too hard to change on a regular basis because they require tools. I wanted a strap that would look, feel and impress as much as the suits I was wearing, but be just as durable as the more traditional leather options. After scouring the planet for just such a strap it became clear that if I wanted my version of a perfect watch strap I was going to have to make it myself.

THE JOURNEY TO GET HERE

210 East Oak is the conclusion of over a year of research, development and iterative design into the creation of a luxury suiting watch strap that’s easy to change, gorgeous and guaranteed to impress. Designed in house in our Chicago studio, each 210 East Oak luxury suiting watch band is made with luxury suiting fabric and a patented quick-release mechanism that makes selecting the perfect strap a more difficult task than actually changing it. In order to make this a reality, we partnered with two of the most prestigious manufacturers on the planet, Holland & Sherry and Hadley-Roma.

OUR PARTNERS AND MANUFACTURERS

For almost two centuries, Holland & Sherry has been supplying some of the finest cloths in the world to prestigious tailors and luxury brands. The Savile Row staple is our exclusive partner for this release because of their exquisite collection of fabrics, the gorgeous patterns and their high-end construction. For the manufacturing itself, we turned to Florida based manufacturer Hadley-Roma, "America's Watch Attachment Company." Hadley-Roma has been making the parts that attach your watch face to your wrist for over a century. We're absolutely certain that, with over 300 years of experience between the two of them, our manufacturing partners are the perfect fit to make the perfect watch strap under the 210 East Oak label.


ABOUT THE COLLECTION
There are a lot of things that make the original, quick-release suiting fabric watch straps from 210 East Oak special. They're going to initially be available in sixteen different patterns, conveniently named for the cities that inspired them. 

You can change the straps multiple times a day if the mood suits because of the quick-release strap mechanism. They're made with high quality materials like wool suiting fabrics, genuine leather and stainless steel and constructed with a turned-edge stitching technique that's so labor intensive it's all but extinct.

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Manufacturing is expensive. In order to release the initial collection of sixteen straps at an affordable cost we need to meet manufacturer minimums. The funding we're raising will be used for materials (suiting fabric, leather, thread, stainless steel), labor (construction, engraving, quality control), logistics (shipping, delivery, etc.) and expansion (20mm strap widths, additional fabrics, additional hardware). But why stop at our funding goal of $15,000? If you help us surpass that funding goal, you'll have access to the following stretch goals:

WHAT YOU RECEIVE IN RETURN

Your investment helps make our initial production run a reality. In return, you get our sincere thanks, eternal gratitude and we have set up an awesome referral program for you guys to us to help spread the word while getting some free straps in the process. 

While we have you here, if you could also share this with friends, family, colleagues, frenemies, acquaintances, bloggers, news outlets and the like, we'd be eternally grateful. In return for your help getting the word out, you can unlock one of the sweet referral bonuses above. And check us out on your favorite social networks at @210eastoak.


RISKS & CHALLENGES

We have prototypes. We have finalized designs. We have commitments from our manufacturing partners. We've been wearing our straps for around two months so we know they look good, function well and get compliments. The only hurdle we anticipate right now is logistics because we're working with multiple manufacturers. These potential delays have been worked into our delivery timeline and, with our commitments from manufacturers, we don't expect it to be an issue. We will update everyone throughout the course of the campaign if any issues should arise.

FAQs

How hard is it to change the strap, really?
It couldn't be easier. Seriously. If you can put on a belt or tie your shoes, you'll be able to operate the quick-release mechanism and change your straps whenever you want.

Can I mix and match different patterns to make a truly unique statement?
Of course you can. There are, literally, hundreds of different unique combinations for you to create.

Will it work with X watch face?
As long as the lug width is of the correct size to fit the strap (18mm for now), yes. This is true of Timex, Rolex, Daniel Wellington and any other manufacturer with an 18mm lug width.

Is it unisex?
If you have a watch that will work with 18mm straps and you want the coolest new straps on the market, yes.

How much does it cost to ship?
If you're in the continental US, it's free. International shipping will cost $25, but that does not include extra fees for customs, duties, taxes or additional costs levied by your country.

Disclaimer
Delivery of rewards/perks is subject to best efforts and not guaranteed. This is to set reasonable expectations for our contributors/donors. This disclaimer is required for accepting PayPal contributions.

story:
Win a free FlatTops™ Solar Security Sentinel valued at $2299 just for getting involved in the campaign via THE FlatTops™ REFERRAL PROGRAM


THE PRODUCT

The FlatTops™ camera system is a portable, autonomous, wireless IP security camera for outdoor applications. It consists of a state of the art 2 megapixel, 360 degree IP Camera housed in a uniquely designed environmentally protective enclosure which provides a 360 degree unencumbered field of view. In addition, the FlatTops™ system incorporates an integrated photovoltaic panel and lithium polymer battery cartridge that can provide electrical supply to operate the system in conditions of low light or even in total darkness.

The FlatTops™ camera system supports encrypted WiFi network connections and can stream real time video to any supported network, including IP based infrastructure and AdHoc Peer to Peer network structures.

Additionally, the system can be configured to record imagery directly onto internal SD card and can store up to a 14 day loop of continuous video whilst simultaneously streaming video to a remote network or operating entirely isolated from a network connection.

Stored video recordings can be accessed remotely at any time using an encrypted WiFi network connection or in situations of totally isolated operation, these recordings can be rapidly downloaded using a laptop computer, tablet or smartphone. For example a security officer or park ranger could simply download the data from a series of remotely situated FlatTops™ camera devices from their car every couple of weeks even if there was no permanent WiFi network established in the area.


THE PROJECT

The objective of the project was to design a versatile IP camera based security product that was portable and fully autonomous.

The system had to be very quick and easy to install without requiring any physical connections for electrical supply or data communication.

Additionally, the system needed to be able to be set up as a temporary or semi-permanent installation yet at the same time be relatively tamper proof, and offer advanced features and accessibility from mobile devices such as smart phones, tablets etc. as well as conventional PCs.

Data communication was a relatively easy problem to solve through the use of WiFi which is a well-established and reliable technology. Solar power was the obvious choice for provision of electrical supply. However, many significant difficulties existed in realizing an effective system utilizing solar power. Although IP security cameras have relatively low power consumption which is well within the capabilities of a medium-size solar panel, it must be remembered that full sunlight is only available for a relatively short time each day. Even in good conditions, a solar panel will only average about four hours of peak performance over a 24-hour period.

Obviously, batteries can be used to store energy during times of low light or night. However, when you factor in all of the inefficiencies and energy losses resulting from transferring energy to and from a battery bank as well as providing DC voltage conversion and stabilisation in addition to non-optimal alignment of the photovoltaic array with respect to the sun then the minimum requirements for the solar panel become significantly higher than that of the camera system alone.

Recent developments in high-efficiency solar cells in combination with low-power, low voltage IP camera technology has made this project a feasible reality.


APPLICATIONS

The IP security camera represents a great step forward in the field of video-based security. It offers significant advantages over its CCTV predecessor. In particular its inherent ability to be monitored remotely via internet protocol wired and wireless networks, utilising a diverse range of platform independent software.  Additionally, its ability to stream real-time video imagery to mobile devices such as smart phones has changed the paradigm of the security industry from one of service provider based monitored security to one of user monitored security.

However for all of its obvious advantages, outdoor IP security cameras are still in the domain of government organisations and large scale commercial security installations.

The objectives of the FlatTops™ project is to deliver the performance of a hi-tech permanent camera installation in a low cost, user installable package that is both easy and quick to install and configure.

Because of its inherent ease of setup, in addition to the security of the semi-permanent mounting, the FlatTops™ camera system has a multitude of immediate applications that many people would not have even considered.


  • House

Imagine you are going on a trip and you want to make sure that the garden and swimming pool are being taken care of while you're away.


  • Worksite

Imagine you have hired contractors for a renovation on your house. You come home from work to find they have done the job totally incorrectly. Without any clear evidence of what really happened in your absence, what started out as a simple renovation could quickly turn into a legal and insurance nightmare.

Additionally, theft of building materials is a major problem with small to medium size sites. The FlatTops™ security system can provide a powerful theft deterrent for a fraction of the cost of a full time security guard.


  • Events

Imagine that you are arranging an outdoor event with lots of people. An IP security camera installation can complement ground staff and assist in providing both a safe and lawful environment. Drugs, alcohol, violence all of these things are much less likely to occur when somebody knows they are close to a camera.


  • Liability

Liability is a major concern for just about everybody nowadays. Having this type of recording security system would be a great benefit to many organisations. For example, in the case an accident, injury, damage or theft occurring in a parking lot. Simply being able to show evidence of what really occurred could solve many disputes and possibly also assist police in apprehending those responsible.


  • Schoolyard

Imagine you are operating a school or day care centre. There have been reports of people loitering in the vicinity of the playground and the local park where the children play. There are parents with obvious concerns about the situation, but what can you do ? Setting up a temporary IP security camera goes a long way to both alleviating the parent’s concerns and also in assisting local police in identifying and apprehending any wrongdoer before something serious occurs. With this system, all this can be achieved for a fraction of the cost of appointing security personnel.


  • Wilderness

Park Rangers or security guards could benefit from the placement of camera devices in areas where problems such as illegal camping or damage to protected areas and/ or trespassing is a frequent occurrence. FlatTops™ camera units could be placed in hidden locations, even attached to trees. Recorded video files could be periodically accessed and downloaded remotely by WiFi from the comfort of a vehicle, without ever having to touch the camera device. Given that the FlatTops™ camera system is solar powered and totally maintenance free it could remain attached to a tree or other remote site indefinitely.


OPTIONAL BASES

The FlatTops™ system features a range of different interchangeable bases which are appropriate for different situations.

The product will be first launched with the versatile cylindrical “Picket Base” as standard but other alternative bases can be easily retrofitted when they become available through the FlatTops™ online store.


The full range of bases that are envisaged are:

  • Tube Base:  For permanent mounting in concrete

  • Picket Base:  For semi-permanent mounting in soil or sand

  • Weighted Base:  For temporary or portable applications

  • Flange Base:  For attachment to solid horizontal surfaces

  • Clamp Base:  For attachment to tubular structures or solid vertical surfaces


COLOUR SCHEMES

Various colour schemes are available for the base, mast, and head sections of the FlatTops™ camera system. Some parts of the camera system are specifically allocated as matt black to reduce internal reflections.

Plain colours and simple combinations of colours are included as standard. Tri-colour combinations such as camouflage colour schemes cost slightly more because they must be stencilled, painted and baked three times as opposed to just once for the simple colour schemes.

Custom colour schemes are possible for no additional cost with the purchase of 10 or more units as outlined in the perks section. Additionally we are happy to work with contributors in the development of a custom colour scheme of your making and can provide you with CAD renderings of your desired colours & patterns.

To use the Interactive colour selector on the website, first select the scene using the media icons on the media selector strip and then flip through the colour choices using the page selector controls on the lower portion of the screen.


DEVELOPMENT SCHEDULE


What has been done so far

  • The project has passed the design phase and early Beta Phase prototypes exist.

  • New patents have been applied for and are now pending in addition to granted patents relating to panoramic imagery and processing techniques.

  • Sample solar panels have been fabricated and are currently being evaluated.

  • CAD and manufacturing designs have been completed.

  • Contract manufacturers have been sourced and manufacturing quotations have been acquired for all mechanical components.

  • Camera and network components have been tested and are fully operational.


What is yet to be done

  • Finalize PCB design for solar charge controller/PSU.

  • Secure manufacturer for charge controller PCB.

  • Give go-ahead for fabrication of moulds for injection moulding and die casting.

  • Get detailed quotations for painting processes.

  • Appoint a “pack and ship” agent for delivery of finished products

Order fulfilment of final product is anticipated to be approximately 6 months from campaign completion.


THE FUTURE

Shadow Technology Australia is continuing to develop the FlatTops™ technology. Support from contributors will allow further innovations and refinements of the technology to become available.

Because the FlatTops system utilizes a modular design approach, many of the proposed future enhancements will become available to existing customers as retro-fit options.


PERKS


SHIPPING

Shadow Technology Australia will secure a “Pack & Ship” agent to coordinate a speedy and cost effective delivery option for the finished product. Given that contributors are dispersed over the world, exact pricing will not be known until final order quantities and delivery locations are known. We will seek to reduce shipping and delivery costs to an absolute minimum through order consolidation and shipping to centralized locations before final distribution. The delivery costs will simply be passed on to contributors without any mark up. We are also happy to work directly with any contributor who wants to make special delivery arrangements.


THE FlatTops™ REFERRAL PROGRAM

Win a free FlatTops™ Solar Security Sentinel valued at $2299 just for getting involved in the campaign !

Refer other people to the FlatTops™ campaign at Indiegogo by using the Sharing Tools on the campaign page and provided the funding goal is reached, the person who referred the most Funds Contributed will win a FlatTops™ Solar Security Sentinel totally free !


LEGAL

Copyright 2014 Shadow Technology Australia Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.

FlatTops™ is a trademark of Shadow Technology Australia Pty Ltd.
